finding: The variant rs10974438 at locus 9p24.2 was linked to mood disorders such as bipolar disorder in prior analyses and represented a shared locus between type 2 diabetes (T2D) and depression.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs62575331 located at 9q33.1 also showed a significant association with time to remission of COVID-19 symptoms, particularly in the placebo arm, with a P value of 2.95 × 10^-8. The G allele resulted in improved symptom remission rates, indicated by a hazard ratio of 1.57. By day 15, the CC, CG, and GG genotypes demonstrated remission rates of 46%, 62%, and 64%, respectively. Furthermore, the G allele contributed to a reduction in symptom duration, with an acceleration factor of 0.71 compared to the C allele. This SNP was found to be an eQTL of the lncRNA AL355601.1 and was associated with height in previous studies. Like rs1173773, rs62575331 did not influence the risk of hospitalization for COVID-19.
title: Genetics of symptom remission in outpatients with COVID-19

finding: The rs8176719-delG polymorphism was associated with the O1 blood group and identified as a significant factor in the study of ABO blood groups and venous thromboembolism (VT) recurrence, indicating its importance in this context.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs41302905-T allele was linked with the O2 blood group, contributing to the broader investigation of ABO blood groups and their relationship with the risk of VT recurrence.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs2519093-T polymorphism was associated with the A1 blood group and was found to be relevant in the context of increased risk for VT recurrence, as presented in the findings of the study.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs1053878-A variant was identified with the A2 blood group, further supporting the correlation between ABO blood groups and the incidence of VT recurrence in the analyzed cohorts.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs8176743-T allele was associated with the B blood group and was part of the investigation into the influence of ABO blood types on VT recurrence.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: Data revealed that the rs10757182 SNP was significantly associated with IFN-β levels in response to LPS stimulation, playing a role as a genetic variant influencing immune function.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: This SNP also showed a significant association with IFN-β levels, indicating its involvement in the genetic regulation of cytokine responses following LPS exposure.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The presence of the rs13291085 SNP was linked to variable IFN-β levels post-LPS stimulation, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors affecting immune cytokine responses.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: Similar to other SNPs in this analysis, rs7020908 was significantly associated with IFN-β production, reinforcing its potential impact on immune responses to bacterial stimuli.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The index SNP rs11244061 exhibited strong association signals for COVID-19 hospitalization, signaling a notable connection with VTE at the ABO gene locus 9q34.2.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs550057 was identified with significant association for SARS-CoV-2 infection in relation to VTE, marking a critical finding at locus 9q34.2.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs138683771 was associated with severe COVID-19 and colocalized with VTE, highlighting its importance in the ABO gene region.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs149181677 demonstrated a significant association with VTE and the ADAMTS13 gene, underlining its relevance in shared genetic risk factors.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The index SNP rs8176686 was associated with COVID-19 hospitalization and colocalized with VTE risk in the ABO gene.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs9411367 showed significant association signals with SARS-CoV-2 infection and was found to colocalize with VTE risk near the ABO gene.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs71503180 was significantly associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection in relation to VTE, indicating important interactions at the ABO gene locus.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1537373 was identified as a regulatory variant in the 9p21 locus, affecting the gene CDKN2B. This finding was supported by epigenomic based fine-mapping analyses and confirmed through single-nucleus ATAC-seq datasets in both healthy and diseased coronary arteries, thereby linking it to the genetic risk factors for coronary artery calcification (CAC). The association of this SNP with CAC highlighted its potential role in the regulatory mechanisms contributing to subclinical atherosclerosis.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies effector genes and druggable pathways for coronary artery calcification

finding: SNP rs746100 was found to be genome-wide significantly associated with five BMD sites, including lumbar spine and femur neck, with the lowest P-value reported as 1.64×10^-9, and also influenced the expression of the ABCA1 gene.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: SNP rs1039406 was highlighted in the locus between ABCA1 and SLC44A1, showing notable significance in association with multiple BMD traits.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs7020681, associated with SLC35D2, was significant in the context of PSA variation, advancing research in prostate cancer biomarkers.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs141610415 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant risk locus for Alzheimer's Disease located within the MPDZ gene on chromosome 9p23, with a minor allele frequency of 0.002 and a p-value of 3.68×10^-9.
title: Extended genome-wide association study employing the African Genome Resources Panel identifies novel susceptibility loci for Alzheimer’s Disease in individuals of African ancestry

finding: The rs35767802 variant on the ADAMTSL2 gene was identified as the most prevalent among the original 103 variants found in severely ill ME/CFS patients, being present in at least one allele in 45% of these patients. The ADAMTSL2 gene is significant as it is part of a family involved in the extracellular matrix degradation and has been associated with EDS. This finding supports the hypothesis of a potential comorbidity between EDS and ME/CFS, given that joint hypermobility, a characteristic of EDS, is often observed in ME/CFS patients.
title: A Network Medicine Approach to Investigating ME/CFS Pathogenesis in Severely Ill Patients: A Pilot Study

finding: The variant rs6477694 was pinpointed in association with the TMEM245 gene, highlighting its relevance as a reported BMI variant that contributed to the identified SNP-transcript-BMI associations.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: For the ABO gene locus variant rs687621, a significant association was found with elevated von Willebrand factor (VWF) levels (p-value = 9.58×10^-20), indicating that genetic regulation influences VWF levels, which have been shown to correlate with severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: A functional genomics approach to understand host genetic regulation of COVID-19 severity

finding: This SNP was noted in connection with RABEPK, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in substance use disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP was linked to DBH and suggested significance in addiction pathways concerning dopamine metabolism.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The previously identified SNP rs73493041, associated with STST interaction for DBP, continued to show significant evidence in the larger cross-population analysis with a P-value of 2.0×10^-4 for its effects on blood pressure.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs7026388 within the PTPRD gene represented a common ASD-SV, indicating its potential role in dendritic spine regulation, with the study highlighting its association with other developmental pathways affected in ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The study found a significant link between SNP rs2275543 in the ABCA1 gene and insulin resistance risk, with the risk allele C associated with an increased likelihood of developing IR (OR=3.50; 95% CI: 1.17-10.42; P=0.011). This highlighted ABCA1's crucial role in metabolic disorders, as the model indicated that this SNP was influential in glucose homeostasis.
title: Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Individuals: Investigating the Role of Genetic Polymorphisms in RNF138, ABCA1, and ESRRG-GPATCH2 Genes - A Case-Control Study in the Indian Population

finding: rs1536076, linked to the gene SH3GL2, was also found among the top 20 associations for 'fast' PD progression where the non-reference allele contributed to an increased risk of faster disease progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs657152 showed an association with estradiol levels, where the A allele tagged non-O blood groups and was associated with lower estradiol levels. In contrast, individuals with the O blood group had higher estradiol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The SNP rs8176719, which tagged the O blood group, was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs657152, indicating that the A allele was related to lower estradiol levels, while the O blood group was associated with higher estradiol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The study identified the missense variant rs11559048 in the SIGMAR1 gene, specifically altering the amino acid at position 208 from Arginine to Tryptophan (p.R208W). This variant was predicted to be damaging according to pathogenicity prediction tools. The Minor Allele Frequency (MAF) for the p.R208W variant in SIGMAR1 was reported at 0.007 globally and 0.019 in South Asian populations according to the ExAC database. The variant was confirmed using Sanger Sequencing, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors involved in young-onset sporadic ALS.
title: Genetic analysis of Indian sporadic young onset patient with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis

finding: This SNP was part of the loci shared between hypothyroidism and TSH levels, reinforcing the concept of genetic pleiotropy in thyroid disorders.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs687621 demonstrated significant association with blood donorship, tagging blood group O and influencing several protein expression levels (affecting 63 unique proteins), which included critical proteins related to blood group functionality.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The rs12344353 variant was associated at a Bonferroni level with prostate volume in the PASS cohort.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The SNP rs1923778, located within the NFIB gene, showed a suggestive association with symptom severity in schizophrenia patients treated with clozapine (p=3.78×10^-7). Although it did not reach genome-wide significance, it was highlighted due to its potential implications based on previous literature on NFIB's role in brain development.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of symptom severity among clozapine-treated patients with schizophrenia spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs4742565, located within the PTPRD gene, was associated with symptom severity, with a suggestive p-value of 1.64×10^-6. This finding was significant in the context of the study, although it also did not achieve genome-wide significance. PTPRD has been linked to several brain phenotypes, which supports its relevance in schizophrenia.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of symptom severity among clozapine-treated patients with schizophrenia spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs9411476 in the ABO gene associated with alkaline phosphatase levels showed a trans-ancestry beta of -0.088, with a significant p-value of 2.99×10^-13 and heterogeneity p=5×10^-24. In the African ancestry, the association was also negative with a beta of -0.228 and p-value of 3.21×10^-16.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The missense variant rs142697917 C>T (p.Pro1505Ser) in the UNC13B gene was characterized in an affected child who possessed two copies of the allele. While predicted as damaging by in silico tools and showing conservation across vertebrates, it was also found in healthy homozygous individuals, complicating its classification. Thus, it was classified as uncertain significance but remains noted due to its observed frequency in South Asian populations.
title: Rare splice and missense variants with evidence of pathogenicity in consanguineous families with autosomal recessive intellectual disability from Pakistan

finding: The SNP rs7853989, located at position 526 (C/G) of the ABO gene, was associated with blood group type A individuals in the context of COVID-19 severity. The study reported that individuals with blood group A had a higher risk of cardiovascular complications related to COVID-19, with a risk ratio of 2.56, indicating that this genetic variant may play a role in the observed phenotypic outcomes associated with the ABO blood group.
title: Blood group A Secretors are associated with a higher risk of COVID-19 cardiovascular disease complications

finding: SNP rs507666 was one of the two common SNPs in the ABO gene that were robustly associated with ischemic stroke, which had been previously linked to this phenotype.
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: Similar to rs507666, SNP rs635634 located in the ABO gene was also robustly associated with ischemic stroke and found to be in near perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs507666 (r^2 = 0.99).
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: The variant rs142792732 in the DDX31 gene showed a substantial association with ischemic stroke, specifically driven by higher allele frequencies in African American cases.
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: The SNP rs786959 located in the SNX30 region was positively associated with DKD, with eQTL data pointing to a relationship between its risk allele and increased SNX30 expression (p=4.6×10^-7), implicating it in kidney disease mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis and omics integration identifies novel genes associated with diabetic kidney disease

finding: The ABO gene variant rs687621 was associated with neonatal jaundice (OR = 0.46, p-value = 1.4 × 10-12), reflecting the influence of maternal-fetal ABO blood group incompatibility on jaundice severity.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: This SNP was identified as part of a novel locus (SEMA4D-GADD45G) associated with habitual coffee consumption, suggesting its relevance to metabolic traits influenced by coffee.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs7034200 at the GLIS3 locus exhibited a significant association with birth weight, displaying a highly significant p-value of 1.15 × 10−12 in the two degree of freedom test, with notable discordant effects: it was associated with increased offspring birth weight when present in the maternal genome, but proposed to decrease birth weight when present in the fetal genome. It was implicated in risks for type 2 diabetes and has been linked to impaired beta cell function.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects

finding: SNP rs855549 was identified with a significant p-value of 3.42×10−6, but specific allele frequencies were not provided. It was associated with the ANKRD18B gene, which is pivotal in various protein interactions and signaling pathways.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The SNP rs2243898 had a p-value of 4.50×10−6, although frequencies were unspecified. It was linked to the LRSAM1 gene, which is involved in critical signaling processes.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The rs2519093 variant at the ABO locus served as the lead variant in the HIS-ancestry analysis, showing a strong association with VTE (OR = 1.49).
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: The SNP rs9298897, located in the intronic region of the LINGO2 gene on chromosome 9p21.1, was found to have a novel genetic interaction with the variant rs17710829 at locus 2q14.1. This interaction was identified through a hypothesis-free machine learning approach and involved cohorts from PPMI and LABS-PD, suggesting complex genetic interplay in PD progression.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with increased asthma susceptibility and severity, as well as increased longitudinal asthma exacerbations. Multiple studies documented this association, indicating that the risk allele of SNP rs2517 may contribute to a greater risk of developing asthma-related complications.
title: PGAP3 regulates human bronchial epithelial cell mRNAs present in asthma and respiratory virus reference data sets

finding: The variant rs7859727 in the CDKN2B-CDKN2A region exhibited the highest population attributable DALYs, at 447 per 100,000 due to its major impact on ischemic heart disease.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The SNP rs1537371 in the CDKN2B-CDKN2A region also significantly influenced DALYs through its linkage to cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The lead sQTL SNP rs1537712 was found in strong linkage disequilibrium (R2 = 0.75) with the GWAS SNP rs8349943 and associated with increased usage of the intron J1 splicing in C9orf72. Its colocalization with the splicing QTL suggested a driving effect from the tagged repeat expansion on the splicing of intron J1.
title: Integrative genetic analysis of the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis spinal cord implicates glial activation and suggests new risk genes

finding: The tolerated missense variant rs2282192 (T allele) was implicated in increased TSH levels and was associated with an increased risk of hypothyroidism, while concurrently indicating a decreased risk of nontoxic multinodular goitre and thyroid cancer, as well as improved blood parameters.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The SNP rs10757274 was found to be causal and shared among 7 trait pairs, revealing its significant involvement in AAA and related cardiometabolic phenotypes.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs600075 was significant within linkage disequilibrium plots and associated with the PTPRD gene.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The SNP rs5896385 was analyzed and found to be significant among the non-intergenic SNPs.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: rs2026801 showed evidence of association with both any PIK3CA mutation and activating PIK3CA mutations, particularly noted as the top variant associated with activating PIK3CA mutations in the MyBrCa study.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The KDM4C variant rs10975835 showed evidence of association with PIK3CA H1047R/L mutations in both the discovery and multi-ancestry validation studies.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs9695393 was associated with the NUP98-HOXA9 fusion protein, which plays a role in regulating RITS and neuronal-specific genes. It was identified as tagging an ASD-SV that overlaps a binding site in ReMap and is adjacent to the microRNA mir-873, linked to reduced expression of ASD risk genes ARID1B, SHANK3, and NRXN2. The disruption of this regulatory process by SVs would potentially contribute to the dysregulation observed in autism.
title: Maintenance of Heterochromatin links Chromatin Modifiers and Neurodevelopment in Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The rs143745791 variant in the NCBP1 gene demonstrated a strong association in the breast cancer-specific analysis with an odds ratio of 5.95, particularly among carriers diagnosed with both breast and cervical cancers.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The rs7872034 variant in the SMC2 gene was associated with breast cancer and another cancer, with an odds ratio of 1.16, indicating a potential role in multiple cancer development.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The strongest association identified in CTEPH was with rs687289 in the ABO gene, which is pivotal for determining blood group. This variant had prior associations with DVT, and patients with non-O blood groups were reported to have an increased risk of CTEPH.
title: CTEPH has shared and distinct genetic associations with pulmonary embolism in a genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs9411378 at the ABO locus on chromosome 9 showed a strong association with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility in Europeans, with a P-value of 2.436 × 10^-11. This association was maintained even when accounting for confounding diseases, indicating that the ABO locus contributed significantly to the susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2.
title: Genetic risk factors associated with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility in multiethnic populations

finding: This SNP in C9orf72 was significantly associated with clusters C0 and C1, reinforcing its relevance in NDDs like amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and frontotemporal dementia (FTD).
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The rs505922 SNP was identified as a significant risk variant in the analysis of ABO plasma protein, which was shown to be a causal risk factor for both susceptibility to COVID-19 and severe COVID-19 outcomes. The protein-increasing allele (C) of this SNP is also associated with venous thromboembolism, further linking ABO-related gene variations with increased risk of severe outcomes in COVID-19.
title: Multi-omics highlights ABO plasma protein as a causal risk factor for COVID-19

finding: The rs199690076 SNP was identified in a biallelic SLC34A3-associated urinary stone disease (USD) case. This variant was annotated as likely pathogenic by Clinvar, indicating its significant role in the disease context.
title: Rare variants in SLC34A3 explain missing heritability of urinary stone disease

finding: rs507666 was found as a trans-pQTL for VEGF-R3, where the G allele was associated with lower plasma levels, consistent with validation in prior studies.
title: Common variation in a long non-coding RNA gene modulates variation of circulating TGF-β2 levels in metastatic colorectal cancer patients (Alliance)

finding: The SNP rs11507683 was identified as a novel locus for anxiety (ANX) associated with the EXD3 gene and located in the exonic region, contributing to the genetic understanding of anxiety disorders.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the two instruments associated with the protein level of ABO, which reached genome-wide significance in the discovery cohort. It was involved in Mendelian randomization analyses that suggested higher protein levels of ABO had a putative causal effect on venous complications and hemorrhoids in pregnancy. However, the LD check did not show a strong correlation with outcomes in the dataset.
title: The effect of protein levels of ABO on pregnancy related outcomes: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was a merged entity from rs950529388 and showed a strong correlation with the leading SNP in the outcome dataset through LD checks. It provided support for the hypothesis that higher protein levels of ABO influence the risk of venous complications and hemorrhoids in pregnancy, reinforcing the findings from the Mendelian randomization analyses.
title: The effect of protein levels of ABO on pregnancy related outcomes: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: SNP rs10965215, associated with the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, was identified in the context of HF risk with a strikingly high MTAG P-value of 2.87×10^-58.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: SNP rs564398, situated in the CDKN2B-AS1 gene as a non-coding RNA, exhibited an association with HF risk, showing a strong P-value of 1.95×10^-54.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs505922, linked to blood group O's protective effect against earlier variants, showed a shift in association direction in this study.
title: Central role of glycosylation processes in human genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infections with Omicron variants

finding: The SNP rs965513, located in the FOXE1 gene, was associated with a protective effect against thyroid disorders, particularly hypothyroidism. The analysis revealed a lower Risk Allele Frequency (RAF) in hypothyroid cases (0.03125) compared to controls (0.0556) and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.548, indicating that individuals with the 'A' allele are less likely to develop thyroid dysfunctions. This SNP also demonstrated a moderate positive correlation of 0.28 with TSH levels, suggesting its role in thyroid function and risk for disorders.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: This SNP was novel for the African American population studying tobacco use disorder and linked to the DBH gene implicated in smoking behaviors.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: Also associated with DBH, this SNP reinforced the connection between dopaminergic mechanisms and tobacco use disorder.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The missense variant rs77273740 in DBH showed a positive correlation with lower vanillylmandelate levels, indicating its involvement in dopamine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs4838190 related to NR5A1 was linked to pregnenediol sulfate levels, indicating its involvement in steroid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs504434 in PTRH1 was positively associated with N-formylmethionine, indicating its significance in protein synthesis.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: Identified as an intronic variant in CNTN1, rs144210190 has associations with dementia and its role in PD was explored due to its involvement in cell adhesion and neural development, contributing to PD risk.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs75260654 was identified as a novel locus associated exclusively with early-onset persistent wheeze (p<6.7×10−9). It was determined as the most likely causative variant through Promoter Capture Hi-C interactions, indicating its role in reducing ANXA1 expression. This SNP was implicated in affecting expression levels in multiple immune cells, notably showing a reduction in ANXA1 expression in naive B-cells. Additionally, in eQTL analyses, it was found that the T allele reduced expression of ANXA1 and influenced neighboring gene ALDH1A1.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of childhood wheezing phenotypes identifies ANXA1 as a susceptibility locus for persistent wheezing

finding: The GLIS3 gene variant rs10974438, associated with diabetes risk and pancreatic beta-cell function, was identified with a meta-analysis p-value of 4.0 × 10^-14, but failed to replicate in the UK Biobank (p-value = 0.001). The GS results pointed to its absence in non-fasting cohorts.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: The SNP rs12376738 was found to be involved in generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) and was associated with resistance to depression- and anxiety-like symptoms and memory consolidation. This finding was supported by previous evidence indicating its relevance to GAD.
title: Comorbid-phenome prediction and phenotype risk scores enhance gene discovery for generalized anxiety disorder and posttraumatic stress disorder

finding: The SNP rs686030 near TTC39B was clustered with LCAT and CETP, suggesting shared pathways in HDL modulation, highlighting its significance in cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular health.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: This non-coding transcript exon variant was associated with carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) levels, consistent with its role as a tumor biomarker.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs919642, situated within the COL27A1 gene on chromosome 9, showed a significant association with knee pain with a p value of 1.25 × 10^-17. COL27A1 is crucial for cartilage structure and function, and variants in this region might affect collagen fibril formation, influencing the structural integrity of cartilage and contributing to knee pain and OA.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Found in the GLIS3 gene on chromosome 9, rs3892354 had a p value of 1.29 × 10^-8, showing a strong association with knee pain. GLIS3 is involved in transcriptional regulation and has been linked to chondrocyte differentiation, vital for maintaining cartilage.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs891720 in the COL27A1 region (chromosome 9) exhibited a p value of 5.55 × 10^-11, indicating a significant association with knee pain in males. Its involvement in collagen structure reinforces its relevance to cartilage-related disorders.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP <italic>rs149411423</italic> was implicated as a functional variant that disrupts a glucocorticoid response element regulating the gene <italic>GCNT1</italic>, associated with IgE levels and pulmonary immune responses, thus contributing to asthma risk.
title: Glucocorticoid-regulated bidirectional enhancer RNA transcription pinpoints functional genetic variants linked to asthma

finding: The SNP rs138702233 was identified to be associated with the MBzP metabolite near the RAPGEF1 gene, evidencing a positive original finding with an effect size of 0.394 and a p-value of 4.29E-08.
title: Common genetic variants associated with urinary phthalate levels in children: a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs4744112 was associated with a decrease in the proportion of CCR6+CXCR3+CCR4-T helper 1 cells in T1D patients. It was located within the transcriptional starting site of ROR2, suggesting its importance in regulatory mechanisms affecting immune cell functions.
title: Genetic and environmental effects on the immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs10967273, an intergenic variant, showed an association with severity defined by l-MSSS in females, with a beta of 0.8289 (p=3.52×10^-8). However, it did not meet significance thresholds in the l-ARMSS analysis.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The intronic variant rs295254, associated with RCL1, was among those linked to time to irreversible EDSS milestones in both unadjusted and adjusted analyses, yielding an adjusted hazard ratio of 1.33 for irEDSS3 (p=9.10×10^-4) and 1.32 for irEDSS6 (p=7.37×10^-4).
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The SNP rs534551495 showed a significant association with AAO of CI, suggesting a role in delaying cognitive impairment onset among the Amish individuals studied.
title: Genetic variants in the SHISA6 gene are associated with delayed cognitive impairment in two family datasets

finding: As a newly identified intronic variant linked to ASATadjBMI (P = 1.3 x 10^-9), its role was suggested through greater expression in ASAT compared to other depots.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: Located at 9q22.31, rs10156602 was associated with the fractional anisotropy (FA) of the body of corpus callosum, showing genetic overlap with insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Found at 9q22.2, the SNP rs3138490 was linked with the left amygdala's relationship to sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs9696811 was part of a significant set of SNPs related to dyslexia and was noted for being linked with other cognitive traits.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The SNP rs56175925 on chromosome 9 near the B4GALT1 gene had a genome-wide significant association with a p-value of 1.83×10−08 specifically in the African ancestry group, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in alcohol use.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs17180299 was identified in a genome-wide pharmacogenomic study that investigated methadone maintenance treatment. Specifically, it was associated with plasma concentrations of both R- and S-enantiomers of methadone in heroin-dependent patients. This highlights the SNP's potential role in influencing drug metabolism and efficacy in this particular patient population.
title: AI-Enhanced Integration of Genetic and Medical Imaging Data for Risk Assessment of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: Identified as statistically significant in the OUD-MTAG analysis, this SNP associated with the RABEPK gene underlined its potential role in the genetic etiology of OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs4237150 was characterized as the likely causal SNP at the 9:4290085 locus near GLIS3, showing a strong association with T2D, HbA1c, and blood glucose levels. The C allele was found to increase enhancer probability and displayed significant allele-specific imbalance, correlating with increased luciferase reporter activity in MIN6 beta cells.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: The SNP rs113985677 was a missense variant in the CCIN gene associated with Tamoxifen response. It altered cytoskeletal dynamics which could affect tamoxifen efficacy in AML patients.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: The SNP rs8176719-TC, associated with the ABO blood group system, demonstrated a significant positive correlation with higher plasma concentrations of soluble CD209 across three proteomic datasets. The associations were exceptionally strong, with p-values of 6.03 × 10^-258, 1.00 × 10^-307, and 1.27 × 10^-75 from various studies, indicating that rs8176719-TC potentially influenced the concentration of CD209, a protein associated with COVID-19 risk due to its interaction with the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
title: A proteome-wide genetic investigation identifies several SARS-CoV-2-exploited host targets of clinical relevance

finding: This SNP was reported as associated with AD only in Europeans previously, and it was just below the genome-wide significance threshold in the European-only analysis of the current study.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The SNP rs10811656 was identified as the lead single nucleotide variant (SNV) at a locus on chromosome 9 associated with coronary artery disease (CAD). The study reported an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 with a p-value of 6.48×10-7, consistent with prior studies that had linked this locus, particularly near the gene CDKN2B-AS1, to CAD.
title: Common and Rare Variants Associated with Cardiometabolic Traits across 98,622 Whole-Genome Sequences in the All of Us Research Program

finding: SNP rs616154 was identified as an invalid instrumental variable in the causal relationship from cardioembolic stroke (CES) to SARS-CoV-2 infection. It exhibited a causal effect ratio estimate of 0.525, which was inconsistent with the estimates of other SNPs. Additionally, it was found to be associated with interleukin-6 (IL-6) levels, suggesting that rs616154 might exhibit horizontal pleiotropy related to the influence of cardioembolic stroke on SARS-CoV-2 infection. The exclusion of this SNP resulted in the causal effect estimate being nearly zero, indicating that cardioembolic stroke might not be a risk factor for SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Robust Mendelian Randomization Analysis by Automatically Selecting Valid Genetic Instruments for Inferring Causal Relationships and Identifying Omics Biomarkers

finding: This SNP had an odds ratio of 1.26 for normal tension glaucoma (NTG) and was implicated in increased expression of CDKN2A, decreased expression of CDKN2B, and exon skipping in the gene CDKN2B-AS1, thereby contributing to increased risk for POAG.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP was associated with POAG showing an odds ratio of 1.3 and colocalized with eQTLs in various tissues including the brain cortex. Mechanisms related to CDKN2A expression were proposed to affect POAG risk.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs2519093 was identified as one of the few variants with overlapping causal effects, as it had a bidirectional causal relationship with coronary artery disease (CAD). Specifically, it was implicated in both the increased concentration of a metabolite and the risk of CAD, indicating a shared genetic influence.
title: Integrative metabolomics differentiate coronary artery disease, peripheral artery disease, and venous thromboembolism risks

finding: The SNP rs1826292621, which is located near the TLE1 gene, exhibited significant associations specifically in females for COVID-19 hospitalization, marking it as a novel finding in the context of sex-specific genetic risk.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The locus chr9:33426577:A:G was found to be intergenic to the AQP3 and AQP7 genes and reached genome-wide significance in the meta-analysis, indicating its potential role in COVID-19 severity.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The rs1412830 SNP, part of the polygenic risk profile (PRP-5), demonstrated a statistically significant association with polyvascular coronary artery disease in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), contributing to an odds ratio (OR) of 5.2.
title: Complexity of Coronary Disease and a Genetic Risk Profile in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes in Colombia

finding: The SNP rs505922 showed dominance effects on plasma levels of the proteins CD209 and CLEC4M, which are involved in cell adhesion and pathogen recognition. This finding was consistent across analyses using linear models that employed non-additive genotype encoding in the UK Biobank cohort.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: Similar to rs505922, the SNP rs8176719 was identified to exhibit dominance effects on the plasma levels of CD209 and CLEC4M, reinforcing the role of the ABO blood group in the regulation of these pathogen recognition proteins.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: The SNP rs507666 was found to interact epistatically with the FUT2 variant rs2307019, influencing plasma levels of ALPI, MUC2, and FAM3D. This interaction highlighted complex genetic effects involving multiple loci in the regulation of gastrointestinal protein levels.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: The lead SNP rs77641763, located in intron 15 of the EXD3 gene on chromosome 9, was associated with the anxiety symptom group, showing a p-value of 4.08×10−10. The EXD3 gene, associated with nucleic acid binding and broadly expressed in the brain, was linked to several anxiety-related conditions.
title: Environmental profiles of urban living relate to regional brain volumes and symptom groups of mental illness through distinct genetic pathways

finding: The lead SNP rs77786116, found in the IFT74 gene on chromosome 9, was associated with the emotional instability symptom group, with a p-value of 4.16×10−10. The IFT74 gene is critical for neuronal migration and has connections to both Bardet-Biedl syndrome and paranoid schizophrenia.
title: Environmental profiles of urban living relate to regional brain volumes and symptom groups of mental illness through distinct genetic pathways

finding: The SNP rs13287767 was associated with phecode 418.1 "Precordial pain" with a p-value of <2.36×10^-8 and an odds ratio of 2.58. It was located within an intron of the NCS1 gene, which is involved in calcium-mediated signaling in the heart.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: SNP rs17474001 at 9q34.2 was identified as a significant pleiotropic SNP for BC with a P-value of 2.48×10−26, indicating a shared genetic link with COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs9411395 at 9q34.2 also showed a strong pleiotropic effect between BC and COVID-19, with a P-value of 4.71×10−26.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs554833 positioned at 9q34.2 was significantly associated with epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) and COVID-19 susceptibility with a P-value of 1.28×10−88.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs657152 at 9q34.2 revealed a significant pleiotropic link between EOC and COVID-19, with a P-value of 6.25×10−25.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs56343119 located at 9q34.2 showed a significant association with EOC and COVID-19 with a P-value of 1.28×10−22.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs12216896 was identified as a candidate causal SNP for the association between BC and COVID-19 infection.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs550057 was identified in the replicated pleiotropic SNPs related to COVID-19 severity and endometrial cancer (EC).
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs77375493 was noted for its association with myeloproliferative disease, where it was established that the entire association was due to a single missense somatic mutation, highlighting the specificity of the related gene's association signal.
title: A power-based sliding window approach to evaluate the clinical impact of rare genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs1011970 was identified as having a significant inverse association with breast cancer when evaluating polygenic risk scores for coronary artery disease (CAD). The analysis revealed that individuals with high PRS_CAD had a lower incidence of breast cancer. Specifically, the study showed that this SNP is a known risk variant for both CAD and breast cancer, as it maps to the CDKN2B-AS1 gene. The negative association for breast cancer was suggested to result from various factors including potential ascertainment biases, cancer treatments, and genetic mechanisms predisposing individuals to CAD while providing protective effects against breast cancer.
title: Inference of causal relationships based on the genetics of cardiometabolic traits and conditions unique to females in >50,000 participants

finding: The SNP rs1576900, an intronic variant in the ADAMTSL1 gene, was associated with increased interventricular septum T1 times. This association suggested a role for ADAMTSL1 in extracellular matrix turnover and myocardial fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs58774558 was identified in the sensitivity analysis and showed borderline significance. It was linked to KANK1, indicating potential involvement in cardiac remodeling processes.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The rs2567705 variant, linked to <italic>COL27A1</italic>, exhibited a relationship with HAPC, indicating a potential role in the disease process.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The rs17801569 (<italic>LINC01507</italic>) was identified as a shared susceptibility factor for both Tibetan and Han populations in relation to HAPC.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The TT genotype of rs1030005 (<italic>LPAR1</italic>) was highlighted for significantly affecting HAPC, particularly linked to multiple adverse blood phenotypes in Han Chinese.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs1537373 was identified as the lead variant in the study associated with intracranial aneurysm (IA). It showed a frequency of the G allele of 52.3% with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.20 (95% Confidence Interval [CI] 1.19-1.21, P = 8.7 × 10^-46). This variant is located within the gene CDKN2B-AS1, which encodes the long non-coding RNA ANRIL, a gene associated with various cardiovascular and neoplastic diseases.
title: Dissecting the Genetic Architecture of Intracranial Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs2231231 from the AQP3 gene was associated with preeclampsia (PE) and the development of later-life hypertension in women 2–16 years post-pregnancy. It indicated different genotype distributions linked to a greater risk of cardiovascular disease (CVD) in women with a history of PE.
title: Genomic variation associated with cardiovascular disease progression following preeclampsia: A systematic review

finding: The SNP rs7035976 was identified as a lead SNP at the genome-wide significant locus located at 9q33.3, which was associated with cleft hard palate (CHP). This locus spanned the genes RALGPS1 and ANGPTL2, where ANGPTL2 is known to play a role in craniofacial development and was expressed in the developing mouse palate.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: The SNP rs2417050 was among the three SNPs identified within the credible set at the 9q33.3 locus, which reached genome-wide significance for cleft hard palate (CHP). It contributed to understanding the genetic architecture related to this subtype of cleft palate.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: SNP rs777676 was also part of the credible set associated with the 9q33.3 locus linked to cleft hard palate (CHP), indicating its potential role in the genetic risk factors for this specific phenotype.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: SNP rs12350252 was identified as one of the SNPs at the 9q33.3 locus associated with cleft hard palate (CHP), reinforcing the genetic risk linked to this subtype and its location within key regulatory regions.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: The SNP rs13294166 was significantly associated with subsequent major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) in the African ancestry GWAS, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.52 and a p-value of 3.77x10^-08. This association suggested that the variant was linked to an increased risk of experiencing MACE following an incident stroke.
title: Protein identification for stroke progression via Mendelian Randomization in Million Veteran Program and UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs1831554 was analyzed and confirmed in previous studies for its association with BMD traits, underscoring its significance in the genetic landscape of bone health.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs2075533, a functional promoter variant in the TNFSF8 gene, was positively associated with an increased risk of lung cancer, as demonstrated in a study from the Texas lung cancer genome-wide association study. This finding underscored the gene's potential role in cancer risk, aligning with the relevance of TNFSF8 in immune response and tumor behavior.
title: A comprehensive bioinformatics analysis to identify potential prognostic biomarkers among TNFSF superfamily in breast cancer

finding: The rs3128509 variant associated with decreased CTSL expression was found to have lower frequencies in the Indian population compared to East Asian and African groups, suggesting differential susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The variant rs2519093 was associated with alteration of E-selectin levels and showcased population frequency dynamics that may influence COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs10972300-T variant demonstrated a positive association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in a US cohort, although no similar association was found in UK cases, suggesting its relevance to AD may be population-specific.
title: Genetic analysis of VCP variants in a Turkish dementia cohort

finding: A rare nonsynonymous variant in DBH, rs3025380, was associated with lower blood pressure, highlighting its protective effect against hypertension. This finding was notable along with substantial evidence for the involvement of DBH in hypertension-related pathways.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: This novel SNP located at SLC28A3 showed an association with HbF levels (beta = -0.73, P = 2.52 x 10^-8), indicating its potential role in HbF modulation.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: In the GWAS of vestibular schwannoma, a genome-wide significant hit was found at rs7341786 near the CDKN2A-CDKN2B genes (p=1.4e-15, MAF=0.47437, OR=1.395), suggesting its association with cancer risk.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The missense variant rs28368148:C>G in IFNA10 was identified to significantly increase the risk for critical illness (OR = 1.56, P = 3.7 × 10^-12), highlighting its role in COVID-19 severity.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs7036656 SNP was significantly associated with several splenic radiomics features, including energy (P=1.5×10^-20), GLRLM run length non-uniformity (P=1.6×10^-16), GLSZM large area low gray level emphasis (P=8.0×10^-9), GLSZM gray non-uniformity (P=3.4×10^-9), and GLCM inverse difference (P=3.2×10^-8). This SNP was also found at the chr9p21 locus, the most strongly associated CAD locus, which provided new mechanistic insights linking it to the spleen's role in CAD.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rs11515 SNP was found to be significantly associated with energy (P=2.4×10^-11) and run length non-uniformity (P=3.3×10^-9). It resides on the chr9p21 locus, which is characterized as a major CAD locus and had limited mechanistic understanding prior to this study.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs1537373 near CDKN2B was positively associated with atrial fibrillation (AF) and was shared with cardiovascular diseases, indicating its role in AF pathogenesis and atherosclerosis.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The rs8176719 polymorphism in the ABO gene was found to have a significant negative association with plasma PfHRP2 concentrations, with a very significant result showing a p-value of 10^-7. While a marginal association was noted concerning parasite density (p=0.01), the stronger link was evident with plasma PfHRP2 levels.
title: The impact of malaria-protective red blood cell polymorphisms on parasite biomass in children with severe Plasmodium falciparum malaria

finding: The variant rs2519093 at the ABO locus was associated with 28 traits, highlighting its importance in the genetic landscape of multiple diseases.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs8176747 at the ABO locus was associated with increased risk of gastric cancer, reinforcing its link to blood type-related disease risks.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs8176746 at the ABO locus was also linked to multiple disease phenotypes, suggesting its relevance in disease genetics.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs8176719 at the ABO locus was associated with a variety of diseases and quantitative traits, further supporting the pleiotropic nature of this genetic region.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs10810632, located in the gene BNC2 at 9p22.2, was identified as having an indirect association with time-to-diabetic retinopathy (DR) and time-to-diabetic nephropathy (DN) through its relationship with the longitudinal trait HbA1c. This finding was derived from the DCCT study where cumulative HbA1c levels were significantly associated with the progression of type 1 diabetes complications. The analysis confirmed that this SNP's effects were part of a complex genetic architecture affecting T1DC.
title: Characterization of direct and/or indirect genetic associations for multiple traits in longitudinal studies of disease progression

finding: The variant rs600038 was newly associated with campesterol levels, achieving borderline significance, and expanded understanding on how genetic variations can impact plant sterol metabolism.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The SNP rs651007 reached genome-wide significance for campesterol association, contributing fresh insights into genetic factors that influence sterol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: rs2519093, associated with the trait of campesterol, came from the ABO locus and showed noteworthy significance in the cohort studied, aiding in elucidating genetic influences on plant sterol metabolism.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The variant rs4977756 was identified as having the highest significance regarding longevity with a p-value of 0.019 and an odds ratio of 0.78. This variant was associated with glaucoma and is considered a key finding in this study connecting longevity to genetic variants.
title: Targeted Sequencing of the 9p21.3 Region Reveals Association with Reduced Disease risks in Ashkenazi Jewish Centenarians

finding: This SNP tagged the NFIB gene and was part of the findings associated with low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Associated with TBC1D2 and GABBR2, this SNP contributed to the understanding of genetic factors in low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs3793577 had previous associations with neuroticism, depressive symptoms, and well-being, in addition to Major Depressive Disorder (MDD). It was found to be associated with cg27589594.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: Associated with increased susceptibility to Covid-19 with an odds ratio of OR=1.10 (P=3.30×10^-12), this SNP indicates a higher risk in non-O blood group carriers.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: At the 9q22.31 locus, rs230222 was associated with a higher allele frequency in the LLFS cohort and was identified as a QTL for the CENPP gene, reflecting its positive original finding relevant to better kidney function.
title: Discovery of genomic and transcriptomic pleiotropy between kidney function and soluble receptor for advanced glycation end-products using correlated meta-analyses: The Long Life Family Study (LLFS)

finding: Identified in the 9q34.2 locus, the SNP rs505922 showed a genome-wide significant association with COVID-19 hospitalization (p = 2.24×10⁻⁹). It was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with SNPs rs657152 and rs8176719, and the potential causal gene was prioritized as ABO.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs657152 was reported to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs505922 and, while not directly associated, its strong correlation with a significant genomic region underlined its relevance in the host response to severe COVID-19.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: Similar to rs657152, the SNP rs8176719 was also in high linkage disequilibrium with rs505922. Although indirectly related, its position highlighted the intricate genetic interactions influencing the severity of COVID-19.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The rs2453555 SNP tagged a highly pathogenic repeat expansion in C9orf72, demonstrating a significant association with ALS risk, as the conditional analysis showed no residual signal after accounting for the repeat expansion.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The rs8176719-TC allele at the ABO locus was found associated with a hypercoagulable state and deep vein thrombosis in the transethnic PheWAS, supporting its established role in COVID-19 susceptibility and severity.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: The T allele of rs391957 from HSPA5 gene was more common in LLIs and suggested a protective effect against anxiety and neuroticism, with an odds ratio of 1.586 for longevity.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The variant rs550057 located at the ABO locus was associated with a significantly increased odds of venous embolism (OR 1.27; p=5.28 x 10^-116), and was one of the variants that provided the largest number of PheWAS associations, showing strong links to phenotypes such as thrombosis.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The variant rs505922 also located at the ABO locus demonstrated a strong association with thrombosis (OR 1.31; p=3.53 x 10^-183) and contributed significantly to the number of PheWAS associations related to COVID-19 severity.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs16909898, located within the PTCH1 gene at loci 9q22.32, was associated with pulmonary function and had a PICS value of 1, making it a predicted causal SNP.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: This SNP was noted for its potential role in PR variation, with a significant <italic>P</italic>-value of 9.20×10⁻¹⁶. Although this was the first genome-wide significant result for this variant, earlier research indicated a gene-based association with a borderline <italic>P</italic>-value, linking SVEP1 expression to risks for atherosclerosis.
title: A signature of platelet reactivity in CBC scattergrams reveals genetic predictors of thrombotic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs3849943, located at chromosomal position 27,543,382 within the C9orf72 region, was associated with C9orf72 repeat status with a Fisher p-value of 0.00001. This finding indicated that rs3849943 was significantly related to the C9orf72 hexanucleotide expansion, which is known to be involved in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). The analysis intentionally excluded the C9orf72 region from the primary polygenic score to estimate the cumulative genetic risk for ALS beyond this known mutation.
title: Cumulative genetic risk and C9orf72 repeat status independently associate with ALS status in two case-control studies

finding: This SNP associated with the ABO gene was previously recognized and continued to show significance in both MTAG-CES and MEGASTROKE analyses.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: Associated with RETN and influenced the expression of 16 additional genes, rs13284665 was part of a regulatory network specifying genetic control over lipid metabolism and immune responses.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP chr9:133018743:C:T was found to be associated with a locus related to GFI1B, which regulates hematopoietic stem cells, indicating its involvement in LTL.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The SNP chr9:133004155:C:T was noted as a functionally validated causal variant associated with myeloproliferative neoplasms, influencing LTL through its relationship with GFI1B.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The SNP chr9:89311173:C:T was associated with the CKS2 gene, which interacts with cyclin-dependent kinases involved in cell cycle regulation, reflecting its significance in LTL.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The SNP rs9411378 revealed significant associations with a range of biomarkers, especially in blood cell measures. It notably contributed to significant correlations with neutrophils and metabolic traits like total cholesterol, showcasing its relevance in understanding COVID-19 severity.
title: Insight into risk associated phenotypes behind COVID-19 from phenotype genome-wide association studies

finding: The embryo FE136 carried a heterozygous missense mutation rs41307447 in the TLE4 gene, causing a substitution of a polar amino acid. Although classified as benign based on SIFT and PolyPhen scores, TLE4 is highly intolerant to loss-of-function mutations. This gene was noted for its role in the embryonic development and has implications in miscarriage susceptibility.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: In a cohort study, significant associations were identified between the A allele of rs7859844 on chromosome 9 and recurrent miscarriages. This variant physically interacts with the TLE4 gene, emphasizing its relevance in the context of miscarriage.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: The rs600038/SURF1 variant was similarly associated with heart failure in the context of the multi-ancestry GWAS, affirming its importance in heart failure susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The T2D-associated SNP rs1063192 in the CDKN2B locus showed a higher odds ratio in the top quartile of cardiovascular disease topic weight (1.19±0.02) compared to the bottom quartile (1.08±0.02), with statistical significance (P=4 × 10^-5 for difference). This finding suggested a link between the genetic risk profile for T2D and cardiovascular comorbidities.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: This SNP was among the seven that had previously reported genome-wide significant associations with NAFLD, indicating its relevance to the disease.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs2174926 related to a deletion of LOC442434 was noted to affect various FOX transcription factor binding affinities, potentially influencing regulatory pathways that could impact liver transplantation outcomes.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: The analysis revealed a consistent negative association between rs8176719 (ABO locus) and alkaline phosphatase levels. Alkaline phosphatase has protective effects against diabetes when present in sufficient concentrations, indicating a relationship with COVID-19 severity and diabetes outcomes.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes and in over 1 million participants

finding: This SNP was associated with myocardial infarction (MI) in Han Chinese male patients, indicating its potential significance in heart failure (HF) and cardiovascular disease (CVD).
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP was studied for associations with coronary artery disease (CAD) in diverse populations including Caucasian, Japanese, Korean, and for MI in German populations, establishing its significance as a risk factor.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This variant was associated with myocardial infarction in Italian and coronary artery disease in Korean populations, highlighting its relevance to cardiovascular conditions.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP showed changes in African and Middle-Eastern populations related to type 2 diabetes and coronary artery disease, suggesting its clinical relevance.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: The SNP rs505922 was found to be associated with increased risk of COVID-19 with respiratory failure. Colocalization analysis indicated that this SNP likely drove the GWAS signals for both COVID-19 and CD209 protein levels, suggesting that variations at this locus may regulate CD209 and thus impact COVID-19 severity.
title: An atlas connecting shared genetic architecture of human diseases and molecular phenotypes provides insight into COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: This SNP was found to have a variance effect on platelet count and a significant negative interaction with rs35417585 which provides insight into JAK2-related genetic interactions.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP was linked to JAK2 46/1 haplotype and involved in significant interactions affecting platelet count, particularly in relation to JAK2 V617F clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: The SNP rs10124571 was significantly associated with educational attainment, demonstrating a p-value of 8 × 10^-19, indicating a potential link to cognitive ability or socio-economic factors.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs10810153 was associated with smoking initiation, with a p-value of 3 × 10^-18, highlighting its potential involvement in smoking behavior and addiction.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs1323342 exhibited notable associations with brain morphology, supported by a p-value of 4 × 10^-12, indicating its relevance to neuroanatomy.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: Found during the meta-analysis, rs944801 was replicated across datasets, which reinforced its link to ocular disease phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The lead SNP rs1160248 was linked to the A2 dimension of ASD, contributing to its characterization by shared genetic architecture with schizophrenia and relationships to antipsychotic medication use.
title: Three Imaging Endophenotypes Characterize Neuroanatomical Heterogeneity of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The rs657152 variant located in the 9q34.2 locus was replicated in the study, showing an odds ratio of 1.39 for the A allele (P=4.9x10^-8). This finding corroborated earlier genetic associations with COVID-19 risk and severity, also indicating its pivotal role in understanding COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: Genetic association analysis of SARS-CoV-2 infection in 455,838 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs8176719 was used as a proxy for rs657152; it showed a high linkage disequilibrium (r^2=0.94) and was associated with risk of hospitalization in COVID-19 patients. This proxy variant supported the significant role of the 9q34.2 locus near the ABO gene in the disease.
title: Genetic association analysis of SARS-CoV-2 infection in 455,838 UK Biobank participants

finding: Variant rs657152 was reported to differ significantly in allele frequency (AF) between COVID-19 patients and the general population, with a p-value of 7.2E-05. It has been associated with risk of deep-vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism, conditions notably present in severe COVID cases.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: A novel secondary signal was identified at the CDKN2B-AS1 locus with rs150046492, demonstrating a significant association with type 2 diabetes, contributing to the understanding of genetic architecture in this condition.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The rs3181356 SNP at the TNFSF8 locus on chr.9q33.1 exhibited a positive association with IgA levels (Beta=0.07, P=1.13×10^-18), connected to the risk of several immune conditions.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: rs2891168 was highlighted as significant in association with CVD risk in T2D following Bonferroni correction among CAD variants.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: This variant was also listed among those significantly associated with cardiovascular complications in T2D patients, as determined through verifying known CAD variants.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The SNP rs146597587, a G>C variant in IL33, was associated with allergy (OR=0.60, P=9.52×10−27).
