This variant was reported in previous studies and showed a strong effect by disrupting a canonical splice acceptor site before the last coding exon of IL33, indicating its significance in the context of allergic diseases.
title: Exon variants associated with asthma and allergy1

finding: The variant rs7862828 was identified near the AUH and NFIL3 genes, and it acted as an eQTL for the RNA-gene LINC00484 in multiple tissues. This locus was associated with multiple traits, including waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The lead variant rs7470773 was linked to maternal pregnancy conditions and overlapped with locus detection near AUH and LINC00484. It was involved in variations affecting nearby RNA gene expression, robustly suggesting a role in preeclampsia pathophysiology.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The intergenic variant rs7028982 was identified as having tight linkage with rs7470773. This variant was significantly associated with the PE-FGR phenotype and was implicated in reduced expression of nearby lncRNA genes, affecting placental vascular remodeling.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The SNP rs768719522 at the 9p24-p23 locus was significantly associated with HGSOC, indicating a large effect size and its presence in a tumor suppressor gene context.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs697449 was identified as a vQTL for PAEP, with a demonstrated additive main effect on PAEP protein levels. The correlation between PAEP levels and body weight varied based on sex and genotype, showing a significant effect in combined male and female analyses.
title: Systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions underlying the human plasma proteome in UK Biobank

finding: The lead SNP rs505922 near the ABO gene replicated associations in all four susceptibility phenotypes and one severity phenotype, Hospitalized/Unscreened. This dual association suggested that the phenotype could simultaneously capture aspects of both susceptibility and severity.
title: Novel COVID-19 phenotype definitions reveal phenotypically distinct patterns of genetic association and protective effects

finding: The rs495828 SNP at the ABO locus showed a positive and original finding with a significant association with severe COVID-19. It was linked to a hypercoagulable state with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.48 (p=1.84 x 10^-40) in critical COVID-19 patients. Among the tested phenotypes, it had the largest association with venous embolism (OR 1.33, p=1.32 x 10^-199).
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs2891168 variant was associated with various vascular traits and was significantly correlated with the POAG-associated genes, exhibiting interaction with rs33912345 that affected expression in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs10811650 variant significantly interacted with the rs33912345 variant from the SIX6 locus, potentially modulating gene expressions associated with retinal health and POAG. This suggested a multifaceted relationship between these loci in influencing glaucoma risk.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs1008878 variant was identified as playing a dominant role in the associations of the CDKN2B-AS1 locus in relation to primary open-angle glaucoma, highlighting its contributory role in the disease's genetic landscape.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs1741032 variant demonstrated significant differential expression changes specific to male populations in gene analyses related to POAG, suggesting gender-specific pathways in disease mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: Located at the 9q34.3 locus, the SNP rs10781542 was identified as having the highest RDB score of 1a, indicating strong evidence of functionality. It showed a significant association with Crohn's disease and stroke, highlighting its role in CVD risk related to autoimmune disorders.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: In two affected siblings, an ultra-rare variant at the CACNA1B locus was identified as a 48 bp insert at the exon 2 splice donor site (c.390+1), which is linked to disrupted splicing. This variant is part of the multiallelic insertion variants represented by rs370237172, which has an overall MAF of 0.017, but the specific 48 bp insert remained ultra-rare and not observed in control datasets.
title: Identification of ultra-rare genetic variants in Pediatric Acute Onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome (PANS) by exome and whole genome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs145791381 was associated with the non-AD inflammation component (PC4) and represented YKL-40 levels that were not associated with AD biomarkers or AD status. This variant was located in an intergenic region and showed genome-wide significance in both sexes.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The variant rs9298673, located near DMRT2, was associated with right ventricular end-systolic volume (RVESV) in women, demonstrating a sex-specific effect on this particular RV phenotype.
title: Sex-specific genetic determinants of right ventricular structure and function

finding: This variant in SCAI was significant only in males for its role as an eQTL in aorta.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The rs657152 polymorphism, located at locus 9q34.2, was associated with the ABO blood group and exhibited a higher risk for COVID-19 infection in blood group A individuals (OR= 1.45; P= 0.0001), while showing a protective effect in blood group O individuals (OR= 0.65; P= 0.000001). This finding contributed to the understanding of how ABO blood group may influence the severity of COVID-19, suggesting a different predisposition rather than a direct infection risk.
title: Correlation of Body Mass Index (BMI), initial neutralizing antibodies (nAb), ABO group and kinetics of nAb and anti-nucleocapsid (NP) SARS-CoV-2 antibodies in convalescent plasma (CCP) donors – A longitudinal study with proposals for better quality of CCP collections

finding: The SNP rs10811662 was significantly associated with GDM, achieving a genome-wide significance level (p=4.1×10^-9). It has previously been linked to an increased risk of T2D, indicating a common genetic background between these metabolic conditions.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs11556579 was found to prioritize 43 genes and was implicated in the regulation of MAN1B1, which connects to Alzheimer's disease mechanisms, suggesting a regulatory pathway critical for longevity.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs35196838 located near the gene LMX1B on chromosome 9q33.3 was identified as a novel risk locus for restless legs syndrome (RLS). It demonstrated a statistically significant association with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14, 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.09-1.19, and a p-value of 2.2 × 10^-9. Further validation in an independent cohort confirmed the association with a p-value of 2.6 × 10^-5 and an OR of 1.10.
title: Genomic analysis identifies risk factors in restless legs syndrome

finding: The SNP rs10901252 was associated with plasma von Willebrand factor (VWF) levels and was noted to perfectly discriminate B and O blood groups from A. Individuals with blood group O had lower VWF plasma concentrations compared to individuals with non-O blood groups. This SNP was linked to COVID-19 severity through its association with VWF levels, establishing its role as a positive original finding.
title: Coagulation factors and COVID-19 severity: Mendelian randomization analyses and supporting evidence

finding: The SNP rs687621 also demonstrated a significant association with plasma VWF levels and was outlined as a perfect discriminator for B and O blood groups from A. Similar to rs10901252, individuals with blood group O exhibited lower VWF plasma concentrations than those with non-O groups. This SNP was thereby implicated in the causal relationship between VWF levels and COVID-19 severity, making it a positive original finding.
title: Coagulation factors and COVID-19 severity: Mendelian randomization analyses and supporting evidence

finding: The SNP rs495828 was identified as a proxy variant contributing to pancreas fat accumulation, which had a measurable association with increased PDAC risk.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The identification of rs2382299 as a shared risk SNP offered more insight into the genetic overlap between MS and BMI.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs471364-G in the TTC39B gene was linked to an increased risk of fatty liver disease with MetS, demonstrating an odds ratio of 3.1 (2.1-4.5; p=0.001). This SNP's association suggests its influence on liver health and metabolism.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: This SNP was the most important variant in the GLN-model for classifying venous thromboembolism (VTE). As an intron variant within the ABO gene, it has been previously linked to VTE, making it a crucial component in genetic predictive models related to this condition. Given the biological implications of the ABO blood group in thrombosis, its relevance is well-supported.
title: An assessment of the value of deep neural networks in genetic risk prediction for surgically relevant outcomes

finding: This SNP was noted as an African-enriched eQTL for NIPSNAP3A, characterized as a predicted stop-gain variant with a frequency of 3.9% in 1000 Genomes African populations and 3.4% in SABR, achieving a staggering significance of p = 1.35e-61 and a beta of -1.44.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The SNP rs951005, related to CCL21, was found to increase the risk for rheumatoid arthritis (RA) with the presence of its minor allele, confirming its contribution to the genetic predisposition to this autoimmune condition.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The intergenic variant rs1888909, approximately 18 kb upstream of IL33, showed a high PIP (1.0) in the GBMI study, attributed to stronger association significance in meta-analysis.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This SNP in TGFBR1 was associated with a protective effect against otosclerosis (OR = 1.18), also exhibiting quantitative trait locus influence for this gene in whole blood.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: This SNP near MTAP-MIR31HG was linked to lung cancer, emphasizing its importance in various cancer-related studies.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The intergenic variant rs7850447, located near MTAP-MIR31HG, was associated with adenocarcinoma risk, showing ethnic signals predominantly in Europeans.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The new sentinel variant rs4879704 near AQP3-AQP7 was identified as influencing adenocarcinoma susceptibility.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Identified as a supporting SNP for the VLDLR gene shared by both IIH and PAP. It was noted that this variant is rare with a MAF of 4e-03.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: This SNP was also found supporting the VLDLR gene, contributing to the genetic overlap between IIH and PAP, and is deemed ultra-rare with a MAF of 7e-06.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: Another supporting SNP for the VLDLR gene shared by IIH and PAP; it is categorized as ultra-rare with a MAF of 7e-06.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: Associated with SLC28A3; it was proposed to have a role in cilia function and is also considered ultra-rare.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: The missense variant rs73382631 was associated with lower white blood cell and neutrophil counts in the African population, marking it as a significant variant in population-specific health traits.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs28368148 variant at chr9:21206606:C:G was linked to critical COVID-19 as a potential missense change in IFNA10, impacting interferon signaling, although its replication was noted to have limited power.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: SNP rs4977574 showed significant associations with Coronary atherosclerosis, Angina pectoris, and Unstable angina in the PheWAS analysis. These associations were consistent across the Gold-standard logistic regression and the Poisson models.
title: Overcome the Limitation of Phenome-Wide Association Studies (PheWAS): Extension of PheWAS to Efficient and Robust Large-Scale ICD Codes Analysis

finding: The SNP rs59906468 was identified as a strong cis eQTL with a beta value of 0.26 and a p-value of 3.6×10^-25 in whole blood, where the A allele was associated with reduced expression of CD274. This finding was aligned with observations in the adalimumab cohort where a trend was seen for CD274 protein expression in dendritic cell subsets. Furthermore, several associations with adalimumab response outcomes, PASI75 and PASI90, were noted in the CD274 region across time points of 3 months and 6 months, with p-values ranging from 0.10 to 8.8×10^-6. Bayesian colocalization analysis suggested that rs59906468 might be a common causal variant influencing both CD274 expression and PASI90 response at 6 months, indicated by a posterior probability of 0.66 for a shared effect.
title: Enhanced NF-κB signaling in type-2 dendritic cells at baseline predicts non-response to adalimumab in psoriasis

finding: The variant rs8176719 was confirmed as the most likely causal variant related to the ABO blood type, with significant evidence of reduced risk for SARS-CoV-2 infection based on its association with eQTLs.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The SNP rs3750434 was related to the protein GBA2, with over 60% of the posterior probability for colocalization of BMI, dietary habits, and GBA2 levels being linked to this specific variant.
title: Genetic control of body weight by the human brain proteome

finding: The shared causal genetic variant, rs12336113, was identified in the context of a genetic correlation analysis between ADHD and RLS. This SNP was located in the intron of the PTPRD gene, which is associated with both conditions. Prior studies suggested a connection between PTPRD and these disorders, given its role in brain function and learning. The identification of rs12336113 as a pleiotropic variant highlighted its potential role in the comorbidity of ADHD and RLS and its influence on regulating PTPRD expression.
title: Shared genetic architecture and causal pathways between attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and restless legs syndrome

finding: This variant was found in the KANK1 gene with a PPR of 0.638 for MAMBA-G effects and a PPR of 0.439 for the GT effect. The KANK1 locus had been associated with lipid measurement in 2 studies and is near KANK2, which has a reported association with LDL-C.
title: Statistical Assessment of Biomarker Replicability using MAJAR Method

finding: SNP rs6477754 was identified as one of the significant loci through COJO analysis, associated with C4 protein concentration, although no specific finding details were provided.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: The rs2228093 SNP in ALDH1B1 was identified as having an interactive effect with rs671, showing a protective association against alcohol consumption.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: The rs8187929 SNP in ALDH1A1 was previously linked to drinking status but the functional implications of this relationship were not fully resolved.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: Linked to CDKN2B-AS1, this SNP was previously associated with primary open-angle glaucoma, highlighting a connection between different ocular pathologies.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: This proxy variant to rs4838069 showed significant association changes in DENND1A gene expression at p=6.24×10−5, implicating its role in retinal gene regulation.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The SNP rs28450540 was associated with lower monocyte count and lower monocyte percentage. It was in near perfect linkage disequilibrium with a deletion at the 9q22.1 locus that was also significantly associated with these monocyte traits, suggesting a strong genetic influence on monocyte counts.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies common and rare structural variants contributing to hematologic traits in the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The SNP rs41276777 located in the untranslated region of PRPF4 and CDC26 was associated with spleen iron levels. It demonstrated a significant beta of 0.17 (p=2.1e-9), implicating this region in the regulation of gene expression related to iron homeostasis and suggesting broader effects on body iron traits.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron homeostasis and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The rs4077515 SNP in the CARD9 gene was associated with increased blood transcript levels of CARD9. This nonsynonymous substitution (p.Ser12Ile) indicated that the risk allele (T) led to higher levels of the intact, active isoform of CARD9, which was noted to affect both the expression and splicing of the gene. This connection was established through significant splice quantitative trait loci (QTL) observations in GTEx.
title: GWAS defines pathogenic signaling pathways and prioritizes drug targets for IgA nephropathy

finding: The SNP rs8176719 was identified as an estimated causal variant that colocalized specifically in T effector memory (TEM) cells 16 hours post-stimulation, illustrating the influence of cell stimulation on colocalization. This suggests a potential involvement of this SNP in mediating COVID-19 outcomes through the mechanism of cell type-specific expression.
title: Colocalization of expression transcripts with COVID-19 outcomes is rare across cell states, cell types and organs

finding: The SNP rs7036642, in linkage disequilibrium with rs8176719, was highlighted due to rs8176719 not being detected in T na"ive cells 16 hours post-stimulation. This indicates that while rs8176719 was connected to COVID-19 outcomes, its linked variant was examined in a different context of cell types, reaffirming the nuanced relationships of these genetic variants in immune response.
title: Colocalization of expression transcripts with COVID-19 outcomes is rare across cell states, cell types and organs

finding: The SNP rs118016068 showed significant association with a P-value of 3.04×10−5, indicating relevance close to the HLA class I region, aligning with prior findings regarding immune responses.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: For SARS-CoV-2 infection in SLE, this SNP was linked to the ABO gene, showing a substantial association with a P-value of 4.10×10^-32.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs507666 represented a pleiotropic trans-pQTL affecting members of the vascular endothelial growth factor receptor family (VEGFR2 and VEGFR3), highlighting its relevance to the pathogenesis of varicose veins.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: Novel risk variant rs72775784 identified at the NOTCH1 locus indicated its potential involvement in varicose vein development, contributing to molecular mechanisms tied to vascular morphogenesis.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: The study found that the rs489347-TEK locus was significantly associated with an increased risk of stroke in sickle cell disease (SCD) patients, with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.46 (95% CI 1.45-4.17). This variant was linked to the TEK gene which plays a critical role in vascular integrity and communication between endothelial and smooth muscle cells.
title: Genetic variants associated with the risk of stroke in sickle cell disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs10761240 in locus 9q22.31 was linked to insomnia and exhibited shared genetic influences with the corpus callosum, emphasizing its role in sleep-related traits.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The SNP rs73581580 was associated with borderline personality disorder (BPD) as it was identified as a significant risk locus in the main analysis corresponding to locus 5, which was linked to the gene EXD3.
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: The SNP rs3125011 was significantly associated with the NOTCH1 gene within the context of OCC, marking its importance as a risk factor.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The SNP rs28937594, located in the GNE gene implicated in hereditary inclusion-body myopathy, had a significantly higher minor allele frequency in the Iranian Jewish cluster (MAF: 0.024, p-value: 5.58e-28), indicative of its role as a founder mutation in this population, in contrast to the Iranian Non-Jewish cluster where it was present but not significant (MAF: 0.0017, p-value: 0.1512).
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The SNP rs657152 was associated with severe COVID-19 cases, demonstrating a significant correlation with the death rate in the Russian dataset (r=0.59, p=0.02). This marker exhibited a homogenous distribution across populations, with higher frequencies noted in Sub-Saharan Africa and moderate frequencies across Eurasia.
title: THE VARIATION OF GENOME SITES ASSOCIATED WITH SEVERE COVID-19 ACROSS POPULATIONS: THE WORLDWIDE AND NATIONAL PATTERNS

finding: The SNP rs677622 located near the TTC39B gene at locus 9p22.3 was found to have a significant association with MacTel (P=3.2×10-09), suggesting its involvement in the disease.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The novel locus rs62560298 (p=1.64×10−15) showed significant association proximal to DENND4C, a gene involved in metal recycling and hypothesized mechanisms of neurodegeneration, tying it into the larger narrative of iron’s role in conditions like Parkinson’s.
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: The variant rs9411335, located in the MED27 gene (Mediator Complex Subunit 27), was identified as one of four novel variants associated with sVEGFR2 levels through a GWAS meta-analysis. Higher genetically predicted levels of sVEGFR2 associated with this SNP were linked to a lower risk of macular pucker (MP), with an odds ratio of 0.86.
title: Genetic Evidence for Soluble VEGFR2 as a Protective Factor Against Macular Pucker

finding: Rs612169, located intronic to ABO, was found to be a shared trans-miR-eQTL influencing miR-126-3p and its validated target gene TCF4, illustrating the genetic interplay between miRNAs and their target genes.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: Identified as a trans-miR-eQTL for multiple miRNAs, rs687289 was located intronic to ABO and was associated with various traits including monocyte count and pancreatic cancer, indicating its significant role in complex traits.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: This variant was linked to 40 protein biomarkers, particularly cardiovascular proteins, and was also located within the ABO gene region, suggesting its relevance to cardiovascular traits.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: In the ABO region, the SNP rs9411378:A associated with COVID-19 positivity versus negative or unknown controls, with a MAF of 24%, OR of 1.12, and a significant p-value of 2×10^-10.
title: Common genetic variants identify targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs8176685 at the ABO locus was significantly associated with early onset ischemic stroke (IS) with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.17 (95% CI: 1.11-1.22). The effect size was larger in early onset compared to late onset IS. This SNP tagged blood group A1, which was found to be more prevalent in early onset cases.
title: Genetic Contributions to Early and Late Onset Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs2519093 was found to be associated with early onset IS, showing an odds ratio of 1.10 (95% CI: 1.01-1.19) in a quasi-replication analysis.
title: Genetic Contributions to Early and Late Onset Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs529565 was associated with early onset IS, with a protective odds ratio of 0.88 (95% CI: 0.85-0.91) in the trans-ethnic analysis, tagging blood group O1 which appeared to offer a protective effect against IS.
title: Genetic Contributions to Early and Late Onset Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs11145951 located in the PTGDS gene was reported to be significantly associated with central corneal thickness (CCT) in the European population (P=9.20×10^-12), indicating a strong pleiotropic association. However, this association did not reach significance in the Asian population (P=2.30×10^-2), suggesting an ethnic-specific effect.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified genes pleiotropically associated with central corneal thickness

finding: The GA genotype of rs11792680 was correlated with multiple vascular conditions, significantly increasing the risk for pulmonary hypertension (OR=6.318) and neurodegenerative diseases (OR=7.129), underscoring its potential role in endothelial dysfunction.
title: The Mechanism of Vascular Endothelial Dysfunction Induced by Ferroptosis Mediated by NARFL Knockout

finding: The rs687289 variant located at the chr19:10351837:C:T locus was associated with severe COVID-19 within the gene TYK2 at 19p13.2, showing significant association in the meta-analysis.
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: The variant rs577463446 was found at the FANCC locus, showing a significant association with atrial fibrillation (MAF = 0.5%, OR = 1.58). This highlighted the locus's role in multiple independent signals for atrial fibrillation.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: Located near OLFM1, this novel SNP was associated with AUDIT-C in AAs; the gene has ties to smoking behavior, reflecting influences on substance use.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: As a variant near BRD3, it contributed notable associations with AUD, marking it as a significant genetic factor.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Also near BRD3, this SNP showed associations with AUD, illustrating its potential role in the overarching genetic landscape.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: In a cohort study involving 764 healthy children aged 11-18 years, a significant association was identified between post-vaccination immune responses to the measles vaccine and the genetic polymorphism in the DDX58 gene (rs669260). This finding indicated that variations in the DDX58 gene could lead to differences in vaccine effectiveness (VE), emphasizing the importance of genetic variants in modulating immune responses following live measles vaccination.
title: A systematic review and modelling insights of factors impacting measles vaccine effectiveness

finding: The variant rs8176719 was identified as the lead variant at the ABO locus. It resulted in the deletion leading to the O blood group, and logistic regression analysis demonstrated a significant correlation with a higher risk of peptic ulcer disease (OR = 1.14, P = 6.0 × 10-14).
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: The rs12347577 variant was associated with gastric ulcer (GU) and was identified specifically for HP-negative patients, showcasing its relevance in the context of PUD through Cochran's Q test.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: The SNP rs505922 was associated with ABO blood type, which had previously established an association with COVID-19. This finding related to testing dynamics over time during the pandemic, indicating that immunological factors connected to blood type may influence outcomes.
title: Socioeconomic inequality in SARS-CoV-2 testing and COVID-19 outcomes in UK Biobank over the first year of the pandemic: can inequalities be explained by selection bias?

finding: The SNP rs8176746 was implicated in determining ABO blood type and was used in the analysis to explore its relationship with COVID-19 testing. Its presence in the analysis linked it to broader immunological implications tied to COVID-19 infection.
title: Socioeconomic inequality in SARS-CoV-2 testing and COVID-19 outcomes in UK Biobank over the first year of the pandemic: can inequalities be explained by selection bias?

finding: The SNP rs8176719, part of the ABO gene, was considered in the context of its established association with blood type and its relevance to testing positive for SARS-CoV-2 infection. This association suggested a potentially significant genetic influence on COVID-19 outcomes based on blood type.
title: Socioeconomic inequality in SARS-CoV-2 testing and COVID-19 outcomes in UK Biobank over the first year of the pandemic: can inequalities be explained by selection bias?

finding: The variant rs78254323-T was found to be associated with overt hyperthyroidism, demonstrating an odds ratio of 1.72, indicating a significant genetic association in the context of thyroid dysfunction.
title: Genome-wide association studies of thyroid-related hormones, dysfunction, and autoimmunity among 85,421 Chinese pregnancies

finding: SNP rs644234, situated in the ABO gene on chromosome 9, showed a significant association with Long COVID (OR=0.95, p=3.66x10^-09). The effect allele was T, and linkage disequilibrium with rs8176719 was noted, which is known for its role in determining blood group types.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: Variant rs8176719 is within the ABO gene and has been implicated in COVID-19 susceptibility and severity. It is in high linkage disequilibrium with rs644234, which was associated with Long COVID outcomes.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: The SNP rs687289 was associated with changes in phosphatidylcholine metabolites and was linked to the expression of the gene ABO, as part of the genetic variants that influence miR-139-5p.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: The SNP rs558240 was found to associate with the metabolism of phosphatidylcholines and it significantly regulated the expression of the gene ABO, related to miR-139-5p.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: The SNP rs176694 was identified to impact phosphatidylcholine metabolite levels and regulated the gene ABO, being one of the key variants acting on miR-139-5p expression.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: The SNP rs11244083 was associated with changes in phosphatidylcholine levels, and it was linked to the regulation of ABO expression within the context of miR-139-5p.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: The SNP rs592514 affected phosphatidylcholine metabolites and also influenced the expression of the gene ABO, further connecting it to miR-139-5p regulation.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: Variant rs12554549 within the PTPN gene was significantly associated with radiotherapy-induced acute skin ulceration in breast cancer patients. This gene regulates cell growth, differentiation, and oncogenic transformation.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs10122243 was found at the CDKN2B-AS1 locus at 9p21.3, showing a significant association with a P-value of 1.75x10-6, emphasizing its role in the genetic basis of endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs62576127 related to the ASTN2 locus at 9q33.1 and reached significance (P = 9.01x10-4), indicating its potential involvement in endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs495828 associated with the ABO locus at 9q34.2 showed a significant correlation (P = 5.87x10-4), highlighting its genetic relevance to endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs612169 was included as an instrument variable for GOLM1, found to be a causal plasma protein for COVID-19 infection with a significant MR P-value (P=2.65×10^-8). Sensitivity analyses indicated that the associations were robust even after accounting for the ABO locus.
title: Plasma proteomics of SARS-CoV-2 infection and severity reveals impact on Alzheimer and coronary disease pathways

finding: In the heart failure meta-analysis, rs147288039 emerged as a significant marker within the multi-ancestry cohort. Its significance was attributed to a higher allele frequency in East Asians and South Asians, with observed frequencies of 0.23% and 0.75% respectively, suggesting it may have contributed to increased heart failure risk in these populations.
title: Polygenic risk score from a multi-ancestry GWAS uncovers susceptibility of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs507666 in ABO was identified through the CC-liability method as associated with hypercholesterolemia and was found significant in additional GWAS studies in the UK Biobank.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The <italic>TLR4</italic> SNP rs1927914 was associated with gastric cancer, with an odds ratio of 1.23 (p = 0.021). This highlights the involvement of TLR4-mediated immune responses in gastric cancer risk, especially in the context of <italic>H. pylori</italic> infection.
title: Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC1) gene variant (rs2302615) is associated with gastric cancer independently of Helicobacter pylori CagA serostatus

finding: The SNP rs2453555 was identified as the top single-variant association signal for ALS, with an odds ratio of 1.19 and a p-value of 1.78e-41. This intronic variant is within the C9orf72 gene, which is known for tagging a hexanucleotide repeat expansion that is one of the most common genetic causes of ALS.
title: The Neurodegenerative Disease Knowledge Portal: Propelling Discovery Through the Sharing of Neurodegenerative Disease Genomic Resources

finding: The SNP rs10960087 reached genome-wide significance in the SCQ stereotyped GWAS with a p-value of 2.5 × 10^-8. It was located roughly 120 kb downstream of the DMRT2 gene, which has been associated with ADHD.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs7854303, located at chromosome 9:5557672 with a minor allele frequency of 3.4×10<sup>−4</sup>, showed a significant association with chronic lymphoid leukemia when analysis focused on variants with a minor allele frequency (MAF) ≤0.01. The p-value for this association was 7.5×10<sup>−7</sup>, indicating that the signals for this association were highly enriched in rarer variants.
title: Set-based rare variant association tests for biobank scale sequencing data sets

finding: The SNP rs7865239 was significant in the context of adiposity traits, where associations were observed with body mass index (BMI), waist circumference, and breast cancer. This highlighted its relevance to the adiposity cluster identified in the PCOS study.
title: Polycystic ovary syndrome susceptibility loci inform disease etiological heterogeneity

finding: The rs180177314 (G>A) mutation in the GRHPR gene was found in 5 individuals, making it a significant finding. This mutation was reported and studied for the first time and was associated with hyperoxaluria in the study cohort. Patients with the AA genotype exhibited a significantly higher level of 24-hour urinary calcium compared to the GG genotype, suggesting a strong link to the phenotype. Furthermore, individuals carrying the A allele showed a 6.59-fold increased risk of disease progression.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) identifies Homozygous mutation in g.37429732G>A in GRHPR gene is responsible for early onset of nephrolithiasis in the population of West Bengal, India

finding: SNP rs11794648 was identified as a novel intronic variant in TMEM245 associated with CUD.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs1106260 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus associated with non-response to SSRIs in a study involving 114,324 individuals, of which 19,606 were non-responders. It had a p-value of 3.55e-08. Further analysis showed that this SNP was linked to gene expression of OLFM1, a gene associated with neuropsychiatric disorders, in the brain regions of medulla and temporal cortex.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: The SNP rs505922 displayed a consistent association with E-selection in both DCS (p = 1.23e-15) and GoDARTS (p = 1.40e-16) cohorts. This reinforces its relevance to type 2 diabetes, highlighting its involvement in the molecular profile alterations observed between the multi-omics clusters.
title: Novel subgroups of type 2 diabetes based on multi-Omics profiling: an IMI-RHAPSODY Study

finding: SNP rs2274836 was linked to the downregulation of the gene TNC in OA cartilage with the risk allele T, marking it as a significant finding in the study with regards to its functional role in OA pathology.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: The p.Ala382Val variant in GTF3C5 was associated with lower LDLC and non-HDLC (MAF=0.008, p=0.02 for both).
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The rare start-lost variant in GTF3C5 was associated with non-ischemic cardiomyopathy (p=2.8×10^-5) and hypertension (p=6.7×10^-4), reflecting its strong enrichment in the Finnish population.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The p.Tyr347Cys variant in GTF3C5 was associated with multiple phenotypes, including angina pectoris (p=9.20×10^-5) and ischemic heart disease (p=6.10×10^-4).
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The functional variant rs8176719 was utilized to determine O vs non-O blood type alleles. It was shown to have a median linkage disequilibrium (LD) of r2 = 0.443 in African ancestry (AFR), significantly lower than the European (EUR) and East Asian (EAS) populations, which had median r2 values of 0.869 and 0.946, respectively. This significant difference (p = 1.1×10-5 for AFR vs EAS, p = 0.023 for AFR vs EUR) highlighted the challenge of using tag SNPs (tSNPs) in diverse populations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The functional variant rs7853989 was part of the group of SNPs that differentiate between A and B blood type alleles. In populations such as AFR, EAS, and South Asian (SAS), rs7853989 demonstrated very high LD (r2 = 0.96-1.0) with other A/B variants, but showed lower LD in Admixed American (AMR) and European (EUR) populations with r2 = 0.72 in AMR and r2 = 0.71 in EUR.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: Like rs7853989, rs8176743 exhibited high LD with A/B blood type functional variants in populations such as AFR, EAS, and SAS. It contributed to the distinction of A and B alleles but also showed lower LD linkage in AMR and EUR populations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The functional variant rs8176746 was selected as a representative for A vs B blood typing. It showed high r2 values indicating good linkage with other functional variants in various populations; however, it was not consistently effective in all ancestry populations due to variances in tSNP effectiveness.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The SNP rs8176747 contributed to the determination of A vs B blood types, demonstrating high linkage in several populations (AFR, EAS, SAS) but displayed lower effective linkage in populations like AMR and EUR.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: rs505922 was identified as a tSNP used to derive O blood type alleles, displaying significant discordance when compared to serological data in diverse populations. It reflected the overall low LD in the AFR group, indicating potential misclassification.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: As one of the tSNPs used to infer O blood type, rs657152 performed poorly across different ancestries, particularly in AFR. This highlighted the challenge in accurately determining blood types using this SNP as a tag in diverse populations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The tSNP rs8176704 showed poor linkage with the functional variant rs8176719, indicating a median r2 of 0.12 across populations. This was particularly evident in its effectiveness in deriving blood type in diverse ancestry groups, particularly in the AFR population.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: In assessment of blood type determination, rs687289 revealed significant discordance in results obtained via tSNP compared to serology, displaying a similar LD pattern as other low-performing SNPs across populations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: This SNP served as a tSNP for O blood type determination but its application was limited due to low LD, indicating potential inaccuracies in blood type classification when applied incorrectly across diverse populations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: rs529565 was part of the group of tSNPs utilized for inferring O blood types but exhibited significant variability in performance compared across populations, underscoring limitations regarding its use as a reliable marker.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: In the assessment of ABO blood types, rs8176693 was found to have low correlation with functional alleles across various populations, contributing to increased discordance between inferred and serologic blood type classifications.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: This SNP was implicated in the determination of O blood types and demonstrated significant discordance when results based on tSNPs were compared to serological findings, particularly in populations with limited representation.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: Involved in the assessment of blood type O alleles, rs8176645 showed poor correlation with the functional variant leading to inconsistent blood type determinations, particularly problematic in non-European populations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: Used for distinguishing between A and B alleles, rs8176749 exhibited variable performances across ancestries, particularly relevant in studies involving populations outside of European ancestry.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: As a contributor to A/B blood type differentiation, rs8176672 showcased variable effectiveness across populations highlighting the challenges faced in accurately deriving blood types in diverse groups.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: This SNP was part of the comparisons for A and B alleles, showing significant variances in linkage strengths across different ancestry groups further reinforcing the issues with tSNP applications.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: Included in the assessment of the A/B variants, rs8176722 displayed performances inconsistent across populations, particularly within underrepresented groups, leading to potential misclassifications.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: As a tag SNP for A/B blood types, rs8176720 was found to have low performance across various ancestries. It exhibited low r2 values in all groups tested, which complicated the accurate assignment of blood types.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The homozygous recessive genotype (G/G) at rs2013566 was associated with increased somatic symptoms such as headache, back pain, joint pain, muscle pain, and somatization, as well as decreased sleep quality, energy levels, and overall quality of life in individuals with IBS. This association was validated using UK BioBank data, where it was confirmed that individuals with IBS who possessed this genotype had a higher likelihood of experiencing headaches.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: The minor alleles of rs1627784 showed a negative association with muscle pain in the U.S. cohort analysis but were linked to increased odds of depression in the UKBB validation, indicating a complex relationship between this SNP and psychological symptoms.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: Analysis demonstrated that the minor allele of rs1624327 was negatively associated with muscle pain in the U.S. cohort. In the UKBB validation, it showed a significant association with decreased somatization and increased headache, providing insights into its psychological impacts.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: The homozygous recessive genotype for rs1147198 was positively associated with muscle pain in individuals with IBS, confirming its relevance to somatic symptomatology.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: Identified a new association indicating that the presence of minor alleles at rs41277883 correlated with a threefold increase in the likelihood of having IBS, although it was not directly tied to specific somatic or psychological symptoms.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: A significant association was detected between genetically-proxied risk of VTE and increased pancreatic cancer risk. The odds ratio was found to be 1.23 with a 95% confidence interval of 1.08-1.40; however, this finding was predominantly driven by rs687289, linked to non-O blood group, and was subject to considerable sensitivity analysis that queried its validity.
title: Causal relationships between risk of venous thromboembolism and 18 cancers: a bidirectional Mendelian randomisation analysis

finding: The SNP rs635634 in the ABO locus interacted with rs12225548 in the TREH locus and rs281379 in the FUT2 locus, contributing to changes in alkaline phosphatase levels.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The SNP rs11244061 in the ABO locus was noted for its effect on gene expression, contributing to the identification of vQTLs.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The SNP rs36147380, associated with a P-value of 7.4×10^-6 and an OR of 0.74, was significantly linked to UC but not replicated in IIBDGC data due to it not being covered in the GRCh37 build.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs73581580 was shown to be associated with SGIT and had supportive evidence from previous studies, marking its importance in the genetic landscape of chronic pain.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The SNP rs10758593 was positively associated with type 1 and type 2 diabetes, which provided evidence supporting its relevance in metabolic conditions. This finding illustrated its pleiotropic effect beyond the primary association with insomnia.
title: Exploiting collider bias to apply two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization methods to one-sample individual level data

finding: The SNP rs748741, associated with the NEK6 gene, was identified as one of the three novel genome-wide significant loci related to the susceptibility of PMR.
title: Modifiable risk factors and inflammation-related proteins in polymyalgia rheumatica: genome-wide meta-analysis and Mendelian randomisation

finding: The SNP rs4977575, located near the CDKN2B-AS1 locus on chromosome 9, was found to be significantly associated with diabetes-related heart failure (OR 1.06; 95% CI 1.04-1.08; p-value 2.91×10^-9), remaining genome-wide significant after Slope-Hunter correction.
title: Correction for Collider Bias in the Genome-wide Association Study of Diabetes-Related Heart Failure due to Bidirectional Relationship between Heart Failure and Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs10811662, found in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus, was among the seven SNPs shared between type 2 diabetes and self-reported depressive symptoms, indicating its role in the complex interrelation of these conditions.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4977756 was linked to Glioma and shown to share genetic influences with retinal traits, reinforcing the connections between brain diseases and eye health.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The locus rs1107329 was associated with increased CRAT protein abundance in plasma and higher levels of 2-methylmalonylcarnitine in individuals at risk of AD. This locus highlighted a potential connection between genetic variants and alterations in carnitine metabolism relevant to AD pathology.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The rs2519093 SNP was associated with E-selectin and other proteins within the ABO locus, indicating a link between this SNP and the expression levels of multiple plasma proteins.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs635634 SNP was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs2519093 and associated with Cadherin-1 levels, contributing to the functional implications within the ABO locus.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs687621 SNP was associated with increased expression of the FAS protein, contributing to a potential protective role against autoimmune lymphoproliferative syndrome (ALPS) by enhancing FAS sensitivity in carriers.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The common variant rs10964101 in SMARCA2 showed an allele frequency of 0.819 in UKB-AFR compared to 0.094 in UKB-EUR (p = 9.49 x 10^-322), suggesting its importance in understanding the genetic factors influencing traits in diverse populations.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The SNP rs3217992 was identified as nominally associated with cardiometabolic multimorbidity (CMM) trajectories, contributing to the study's findings regarding genetic influences on CMM. The involvement of the gene CDKN2B-AS1, which contains this SNP, was particularly noted.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: The SNP rs4977574 was found to be nominally associated with CMM trajectories. This SNP, also located within the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, reinforced the genetic connection to CMM observed in the study.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: The SNP rs7859727 was associated with CMM trajectories in the study. Like the other SNPs mentioned, it was part of the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, highlighting its significant role in the genetic predisposition to cardiometabolic issues.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: This SNP was noted as being shared between anxiety and major depression, indicating its relevance to both conditions. However, additional functional information was not discussed.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs2383207 demonstrated a significant association with ischemic stroke (IS) as well, relating to cyclin dependent kinase inhibitors (CDKN2A/CDKN2B), suggesting a role in the cell cycle regulation that may impact IS susceptibility.
title: Integrative genetic analysis reveals new relationships between intraocular pressure, glaucoma and ischemic stroke risk: A study based on combined SNP-to-gene, mendelian randomization and pathway investigations

finding: The rs74853476 variant in the DBH gene was identified as a splice donor pLoF variant associated with lower BP. Carriers of this variant had a diastolic BP that was 1.2 mmHg below the average. This variant was characterized as pathogenic and had not been reported in previous GWAS of BP.
title: Association analyses of predicted loss-of-function variants prioritized 15 genes as blood pressure regulators

finding: The SNP rs10867108, located in the 3' UTR of CACNA1B, was found to have regulatory implications in the context of bipolar disorder.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The lnc-ABCA1-1:1 lincRNA RP11-217B7.2 was nominated as a potential causal gene for both POAG and IOP at the locus rs2472494 on chromosome 10.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: Similar to rs2472494, RP11-217B7.2 is also linked to the shared POAG and IOP locus at rs2472493, suggesting its importance in related phenotypes.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The rs558240 SNP at the ABO locus was the lead SNP associated with Endoglin plasma levels, showing extremely significant association with a p-value of 4.25 x 10^-262. The ABO locus was noted to explain approximately 5% of the inter-individual variability in ENG plasma levels.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The intronic rs10987756 SNP in the ENG gene was ranked third in association with Endoglin plasma levels, with a p-value of 2.35 x 10^-36 indicating a significant correlation.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs2519093 SNP within the ABO locus was a marker for blood group A1 and contributed to the association with Endoglin levels, illustrating the ABO group's genetic influence on these plasma levels.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs1053878 SNP associated with the ABO locus contributed to understanding blood group A2's effects on Endoglin levels, adding to the overall genetic factors impacting plasma levels.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs8176743 SNP, which is a variant in the ABO locus, was involved in the context of blood group B, also associated with Endoglin plasma levels, further reinforcing the genetic basis behind these associations.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs8176719 SNP was associated with blood group O1 and provided additional evidence for its role in influencing Endoglin plasma levels based on ABO typing.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs41302905 SNP was linked to blood group O2 within the ABO gene locus, contributing to the overall genetic influences on Endoglin plasma levels consistent with ABO blood type assignments.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The variant rs943786398, creating a non-canonical TIS (uCUG), was identified in two unrelated patients with suspected Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia (HHT). This variant was associated with decreased Endoglin levels, providing strong evidence for its pathogenicity.
title: Unveiling Endoglin non canonical regulation: spotlight on the new role of the uPAR pathway

finding: The SNP rs77641763, located within the EXD3 gene on chromosome 9q34.3, was found to have a highly significant association with hip pain, presenting a p value of 2.20 x 10^-13. This finding was part of a genome-wide association study that identified genetic variants related to hip pain, highlighting the importance of the EXD3 gene in the pathology of this phenotype.
title: A genome-wide association study identifies genetic variants associated with hip pain in the UK Biobank cohort (N=221,127)

finding: Associated with testosterone regulation, the variant rs10988865 near NR4A3 displayed a beta value of -0.0161 and had a significant p-value (P=4.33E-08), reflecting its involvement in hormonal response.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs3010439 was found to interact with a fruit and vegetable dietary pattern, influencing HbA1c levels. Analysis indicated that this interaction, having a p-value reaching genome-wide significance, also indicated an enhancement of the dietary pattern's protective effect in individuals with the alternate allele.
title: Genome-wide gene-diet interaction analysis in the UK Biobank identifies novel effects on Hemoglobin A1c

finding: This SNP in DBH was found to be associated with reduced hypertension risk, highlighting a protective role in the condition.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: The rs657152 SNP associated with the ABO blood locus indicated that individuals with the A COVID risk allele had greater odds of heart failure (OR 1.09), diabetes mellitus (OR 1.05), and hypercholesterolemia (OR 1.04). Additionally, lower odds of gastrointestinal disorders like duodenal ulcer were found (OR 0.88). These findings were novel and highlighted the SNP's role in amplifying risk factors for adverse COVID-19 outcomes.
title: A Phenome Wide Association Study of Severe COVID-19 Genetic Risk Variants

finding: The polymorphism rs965513 in the FOXE1 gene was identified as predisposed to thyroid cancer in a European cohort. This finding related to the context of thyroid follicular carcinoma, which was discussed in conjunction with NF-κB-mediated inflammation, impacting thyroid-specific transcription factors and signaling pathways.
title: NF-κB Mediated Thyroid Inflammation and Its Implications for the Risk of Follicular Thyroid Carcinoma: a systematic review

finding: The SNP rs13301996 was significantly associated with waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI (WHRadjBMI) following meta-analysis with an independent sample of individuals of African descent, with a p-value of 2.88×10−8. This locus was intronic to CDK5RAP2, a regulator of CDK5 activity implicated in several health conditions, including primary microcephaly and Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: The variant rs57862396 on chromosome 9 was replicated in the same FEV1/FVC decline phenotype analysis, showing a consistent association with slower rates of FEV1/FVC decline across both discovery and replication cohorts.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study reveals novel genetic signals for lung function decline

finding: This SNP located in an intron of PTPRD showed significant associations with both TR (p=7.7E-08) and THR (p=6.1E-08), indicating its potential role in influencing relapse risk among naltrexone-treated patients.
title: Genetic Contributions to Alcohol Use Disorder Treatment Outcomes: A Genome-wide Pharmacogenomics Study

finding: The SNP rs2230578 was located in the 3' UTR of ROR2 at locus 9q22.31, linking it to previous findings on craniofacial morphology, especially regarding nose size.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: This SNP was also identified as newly FDR significant after leveraging additional functional genomic data, holding a high GenoCanyon score.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: This SNP affected TRIM14 expression and disrupted a miRNA binding site, indicating its potential role in enhancing antiviral activity.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: This SNP is located in the JAK2 gene and was found to significantly increase AAA prevalence, with a p-value of 3.26x10^-8 and an OR of 2.776. Higher expression levels of JAK2 were noted in patients with AAA compared to controls.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: The rs1537373 variant was associated with AAA with a p-value of 6.68x10^-7 and an OR of 0.821. It resides in the CDKN2B-AS1 gene which is implicated in traits associated with coronary artery disease.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of extracellular matrix (ECM) molecules in the context of high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). Specifically, it was linked to TGFβR signaling pathways that influenced the phenotypic behavior of cancer-associated fibroblasts which enhanced tumor growth.
title: Modelling TGFβR and Hh pathway regulation of prognostic matrisome molecules in ovarian cancer

finding: The SNP rs10120514 was associated with racial disparity in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) among African-American women, as detailed in the study by Siddharth and Sharma (2018). This finding shed light on the multifaceted relationship between obesity, biological factors, and socioeconomic determinants that influence the prevalence and characteristics of TNBC.
title: Medicago Sativa Defensin 1 (MsDef1), A Natural Tumor Targeted Sensitizer for Improving Chemotherapy: Translation from Anti-Fungal Agent to Potential Anti-Cancer Agent

finding: The variant rs77375493, identified as V617F, was associated with myeloproliferative neoplasms. It was discovered in the context of six out of seven biomarker associations for JAK2, only identified by kernel-based tests.
title: Identifying interpretable gene-biomarker associations with functionally informed kernel-based tests in 190,000 exomes

finding: The SNP rs10985080, located at chr9:120,896,106-120,897,428, was part of the intergenic enhancer on the TRAF1 haplotype. It exhibited expression-altering capabilities when analyzed through MPRA, demonstrating a significant impact on the expression of the PHF19 gene due to its regulatory role.
title: A Systematic Strategy for Identifying Causal Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms and Their Target Genes on Juvenile Arthritis Risk Haplotypes

finding: The SNP rs73493041, associated with the SNORA26/C9orf170 gene, demonstrated significant 1df interactions with short sleep duration (STST) in the same primary analysis, and it was also confirmed in the replication stage. Furthermore, it was linked to self-reported chronotype, indicating its potential influence on BP regulation.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide gene-sleep interactions identify novel loci for blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs587779903 caused a L536P mutation in FANCC, which was shown to disrupt protein function due to significant destabilization.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the B. bifidum species, indicating a new association at the ABO locus affecting microbiome composition.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The association with Collinsella aerofaciens at rs550057 was indicative of novel relationships at the ABO locus, affecting higher order taxa and metabolic pathways related to lactose degradation.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: Associated with the metabolic pathway LACTOSECAT-PWY, the SNP demonstrated significant implications in the degradation of lactose and galactose.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The SNP rs524137 was associated with the GFI1B transcription factor, where it served as an intergenic enhancer. It led to the identification of 569 differentially expressed genes, among which 321 replicated in a previous study targeting this locus. This suggests its substantial role in the regulation of hematopoiesis.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: The SNP rs73660574, identified as a weaker intronic enhancer for GFI1B, was linked to the regulation of 28 differentially expressed genes, with many overlapping those influenced by rs524137. Thus, it demonstrated its contribution to the regulatory network involving GFI1B.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: SNP rs2519093 was noted for its independence and influence in the ABO locus. It acted trans on multiple proteins and was linked to several metabolic disease phenotypes, emphasizing its pleiotropic effects.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: This SNP was involved in trans-acting effects on several proteins, including those related to lipid levels and metabolic disorders, and was also identified as a cis eQTL for various genes, reinforcing its complex regulatory role.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: rs687621 demonstrated a strong association with PUD, being statistically significant in the discovery GWAS, and it has high LD with rs505922. This SNP was associated with the risk of duodenal ulcers possibly after Helicobacter pylori infection.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: rs10512344 was the only SNP genome-wide significantly associated with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) in the UKB data. It reaffirmed association within the study with IBS at a suggestive genome-wide level.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: rs112243849 was associated with IBS at genome-wide suggestive levels, supporting its relevance in the phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: rs7861675 was linked to IBS+M, further confirming the association with IBS phenotypes at the genome-wide level.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: The study on rs1851716 provided insights into its VAF in matched tumor:normal samples from germline heterozygous individuals. It highlighted deviations from expected values, suggesting a potential link between the variation at this locus and oncogenic processes during cancer development, emphasizing its evolutionary relevance and impact on genome stability.
title: Detecting oncogenic selection through biased allele retention in The Cancer Genome Atlas

finding: The synonymous SNP rs35565319 located in the PAPPA gene was previously implicated in cerebellar volume associations and was noted for potential cerebellar-specific effects.
title: Identifying genetic variants associated with cerebellar volume in 33,265 individuals from the UK-Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10810645 in the BNC2 gene was also associated with self-perceived facial aging, marking it as a significant genetic variant in this context.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: This SNP's involvement was noted in the context of breast cancer management and detection. It highlighted the effects of age on breast cancer, thus affirming its significance as a biomarker for diagnosis and therapy in breast cancer patients.
title: LASSO Based Analysis for Prediction of Prognostic Signature Genes Associated with Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs10120520 was associated with the oncogenic activation of Nrf2, characterized as a master antioxidant transcription factor. The finding indicated that the specific knockout of the full-length Nrf1 alpha, which acted as a dominant tumor repressor, liberated Nrf2's activity, thus contributing to tumorigenesis.
title: TCF11 Has a Potent Tumor-Repressing Effect than Its Prototypic Nrf1α by Definition of both Similar yet Different Regulatory Profiles, with a Striking Disparity from Nrf2

finding: A significant gene-alcohol interaction effect on triglyceride levels was identified with rs142488686 in SMC5, an aspect not established before. This finding pointed out the potential new interactions involving this gene and alcohol consumption.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: The SNP rs13284520, found on chr9q34 within the DBH gene, was recognized for its significant association with nicotine dependence (ND). This further extended the genetic understanding of smoking-related traits.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs56118985 in the JAK2 gene was evaluated as a predictive marker for treatment responses in Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) patients. The study by Xu et al. suggested that this polymorphism could potentially inform the effectiveness of chemotherapy, thereby influencing treatment strategies for individuals diagnosed with AML.
