title: Clinical Forecasting using Ex Vivo Drug Sensitivity Profiling of Acute Myeloid Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs10120514 was identified as a significant marker in the context of triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) among African American women. This finding was part of a larger study that aimed to address racial disparities in TNBC prognosis and treatment options. The context highlighted the importance of race-specific gene expression patterns and their role in influencing patient outcomes.
title: Updated Biomarkers for TNBC in African vs. Caucasian American Women

finding: The genetic effect of the rs11265809 variant on GADD45G expression was observed only in the first tertile of the dexamethasone response pseudotime, indicating its potential links to asthma and systemic lupus erythematosus.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs1412832 was associated with increased risk of developing pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, as reported in a study by Giaccherini et al., confirming its relationship with the disease.
title: Explainable models using transcription factor binding and epigenome patterns at promoters reveal disease-associated genes and their regulators in the context of cell-types

finding: SNP rs1023000, located in the FNBP1 gene, was identified as associated with sensitivity to uprosertib. This finding emerged from a direct quantitative trait locus analysis and highlighted the importance of genomic features in predicting drug responses in breast cancer therapies.
title: Deciphering the Signaling Network Landscape of Breast Cancer Improves Drug Sensitivity Prediction

finding: The rs4744423 T2D risk allele (T) was associated with increased chromatin accessibility of an ER stress-induced CRE, enhancing the binding affinity of the transcription factor BATF. This variant was linked to higher expression of the gene AOPEP, a putative effector gene involved in T2D.
title: Comparative Multi-omic Mapping of Human Pancreatic Islet Endoplasmic Reticulum and Cytokine Stress Responses Provides Insights into Type 2 Diabetes Genetics

finding: The SNP rs8176685 was linked to pancreatic fat and volume, with significant ties to lipid and cardiovascular health conditions.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP CD274/rs4143815-G was found to decrease in frequency from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, which may contribute to differing immune responses between the populations.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: This SNP showed correlation to acetylation peak heights within a C9orf3 intron and was a significant eQTL according to the GTEx project.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The study involved the utilization of allele-specific signal quantification for the SNP rs4977575, identified through the ATAC-dPCR method applied to the ECAD9 gene. This method enabled a quantitative assessment of the allele-specific expression, ultimately relating to the understanding of chromatin interactions and regulatory sequences associated with gene regulation.
title: Ultrafine mapping of chromosome conformation at hundred basepair resolution reveals regulatory genome architecture

finding: This SNP was classified as a stop gained mutation in a cilium and flagella related gene, CFAP157. Its relevance was highlighted in discussions about its effect on gene expression in relation to neurological development.
title: Derived Homo sapiens cis-eQTL regulation: implications for brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs7040887 was associated with DNA tumor-viral integration site selection specifically regarding HPV. The study suggested roles for genetic repeats, gene expression, and epigenetics in integration, which may relate to the presence and impact of viral elements like HPV16 in cervical cancer, as indicated by the variant's association with increased cervical cancer incidence.
title: Human papillomavirus type 16 sub-lineages and integration in cancer

finding: The rs73581580 SNP was found to be associated with chronic back pain in the discovery cohort, demonstrating a genome-wide significant association.
title: Analysis of genetically independent phenotypes identifies shared genetic factors associated with chronic musculoskeletal pain at different anatomic sites

finding: The SNP rs3818283 in the TEK gene was highlighted for its role in angiogenesis and mutations linked to AML, emphasizing its importance in leukemogenesis.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The missense variant rs551564683, encoding p.Asn352Ser in gene B4GALT1, was strongly associated with a 13.5 mg/dl lower LDL-C level (p=1.6E-15) in an Amis-enriched population. This variant also revealed significant linkage disequilibrium with other variants in the region and was classified as damaging by multiple in silico prediction tools.
title: Genetic and functional evidence relates a missense variant in B4GALT1 to lower LDL-C and fibrinogen

finding: The SNP rs41426344 was identified as increasing susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) within a central south Chinese Han population. This finding supports the involvement of TLR4 in the pathogenesis of RA, as TLR4<sup>+</sup> T cells were shown to play a crucial role in inflammatory activity and antibody production, thereby linking the genetic variant to the phenotypic manifestations of these arthritis conditions.
title: Direct tissue sensing reprograms TLR4+ Tfh-like cells inflammatory profile in the joints of rheumatoid arthritis patients

finding: This lead SNP showed long-range interactions with the KLF4 gene, demonstrating potential functional implications in psoriasis. Enhancer-associated SNPs in tight LD with rs10979182 were tied to regulatory marks indicative of enhancer activity.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: As the most likely regulatory SNP within enhancer 3, it was involved in interactions that enhanced KLF4 expression significantly when activated via CRISPR, implicating its role in psoriasis-associated gene regulation.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The SNP rs62541556 was found to have a highly significant association with Polycythemia Vera (PV), with a p-value of 8.85E-21. This germline SNP in JAK2 was linked to the 46/1 haplotype that has been implicated in myeloproliferative neoplasms and increased susceptibility to V617F-mutant clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Iron homeostasis governs erythroid phenotype in Polycythemia Vera

finding: At the 9q33.1 locus, rs811688 was identified within a stretch of chromatin interactions that had significant enrichment with the PAPPA promoter in MCF7 breast cancer cells. PAPPA, which is associated with breast cancer, was shown to be frequently overexpressed in luminal B breast tumors, thus indicating a link of this SNP to breast cancer risk.
title: Chromatin interactome mapping at 139 independent breast cancer risk signals

finding: The SNP rs10217586 was highlighted for its role as an sQTL for CDKN2B-AS1, with significant associations indicating its genetic influence on splicing events in CAD contexts.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The SNP rs602075 in the 9q21 locus showed a suggestive association with the abundance of Allisonella, with a p-value of 3.57×10⁻⁸, indicating a potential role in host-microbiota interactions through the metabolic regulation of enzymes involved in riboflavin and mucin biosynthesis.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: The binding interaction of QKI with the lncRNA was differentially affected by SNP rs10967586, suggesting it played a significant role in the lncRNA's functional dynamics.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs12005199 was associated with platelet counts, acting as a common SNP within the distal enhancer region approximately 220kb upstream of the JAK2 locus. This association was highlighted in the context of variants including pLoF CNVs at the JAK2 locus.
title: Influences of rare copy number variation on human complex traits

finding: The minor C allele of the SNP rs7873784 was found to be associated with rheumatoid arthritis and type-2 diabetes mellitus, indicating its role in binding PU.1 and enhancing TLR4 expression.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: An updated meta-analysis suggested an association between rs2230806 in the ABCA1 gene and coronary artery disease, providing evidence for its involvement in this condition.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This previously reported AAM signal in KDM4C was identified as a non-synonymous variant associated with male puberty timing, which encodes a lysine-specific demethylase.
title: Expanded genomic analyses for male voice-breaking highlights a shared phenotypic and genetic basis between puberty timing and hair colour

finding: The SNP rs10988589, located in the GPR107 gene, was identified as the most important feature when analyzing the merged exome and metabolome data. This highlights its potential role as a genetic biomarker for developmental dyslexia, influenced by biological factors in the thalamus and cerebellum.
title: A data-fusion approach to identifying developmental dyslexia from multi-omics datasets

finding: The SNP rs764141336 represented a homozygous nonsense variant (c.802C>T; p.Arg268*) identified in a patient displaying a typical ciliopathy phenotype. This phenotype included congenital hydrocephalus, polydactyly, renal agenesis, and other congenital anomalies. The rarity of this variant was highlighted, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.0000239 in gnomAD and 0.001 in a cohort of 2,379 ethnically matched exomes. Sanger sequencing confirmed that the affected male was homozygous for the mutation while his parents and two sisters were heterozygous carriers. This provided a strong link between WDR31 and ciliopathy, identifying it as a novel cilia-related gene.
title: WDR31 is a novel ciliopathy protein displaying functional redundancy with GTPase-activating proteins ELMOD and RP2 in recruiting BBSome to cilium

finding: The association between thyroid cancer polygenic risk scores (PRS) and BRAF somatic mutations was identified. It was observed that the likelihood of acquiring a BRAF mutation in the context of thyroid cancer was influenced by the germline background of the patient, specifically the alleles at rs1588635. This highlighted the potential for germline variants to affect somatic mutation development in thyroid cancer.
title: The landscape of interactions between cancer polygenic risk scores and somatic alterations in cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs7870388 at the PTPRD locus was significantly associated with disease pseudotime in the ROS/MAP cohort, showing a p-value of 1.31 x 10^-6. PTPRD was linked to susceptibility to neurofibrillary tangle formation independent of amyloid deposition.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: SNP rs943840 was part of a group connected to greater thickness in the supramarginal cortex in MDD, reflecting its impact.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs12351417 was part of a set indicating a positive correlation with greater SA of the temporal pole in BD, highlighting its importance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs72724966 was linked to greater CT in dorsolateral prefrontal cortex for BD, emphasizing its impact on psychiatric disorders.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The rs10757274 SNP located on chromosome 9p21 was associated with approximately a 30% increased risk of coronary heart disease (CHD). Individuals with the GG genotype exhibited significant alterations in lipid metabolism, specifically a reduction in lysophospholipids (lysoPLs) and lysophosphatidic acids (lysoPAs), which were not observed in other common CHD risk SNPs. This metabolic dysregulation was linked to altered expression of the long non-coding RNA ANRIL, suggesting that this SNP contributes to CHD risk through complex immune-bioactive phospholipid alterations and enzymatic pathways.
title: Metabolic dysregulation of the lysophospholipid/autotaxin axis in the chromosome 9p21 gene SNP rs10757274

finding: Associated with activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT), rs676996 was identified as another key SNP with a significant p-value of 8.99×10−72. This association contributed to the understanding of the genetic factors influencing coagulation phenotypes in the studied population.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: SNP rs3793577 was associated with the ELAVL2 gene, a neural-specific RNA-binding protein. Its identification highlighted a significant connection to sociability as well as its relevance in the context of MDD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of sociability in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs7020813 was identified as being positively associated with the function of voltage-gated ion channels, specifically in the context of cancer cell proliferation. The research highlighted the relevance of ion channels, including hERG, in the mechanism of cancer progression. The role of hERG, known for its potassium channel characteristics, was analyzed in relation to various SNPs, including rs7020813, which may influence the behavior of these ion channels, particularly in cancerous cells.
title: Mechanism of hERG inhibition by gating-modifier toxin, APETx1, deduced by functional characterization

finding: This variant was a caQTL for a B cell-specific site with significant allelic effects (π=0.79, q-value=0.003), providing insights into its influence on B cell function.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The rs10821415 SNP was located within the C9orf3-AF region and was linked to activation of gene expression in HL-1 cardiomyocytes. The risk allele was associated with lower expression of C9orf3 in atrial tissue, suggesting its influence as a regulatory element connected to AF risk.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs1563963464 was confirmed to significantly alter the binding affinity of U2AF2, a pre-mRNA splicing factor. This mutation was particularly associated with Ataxia-oculomotor apraxia syndrome, demonstrating its pathogenic influence on RNA binding interactions. Validation through EMSA revealed the substantial change in binding dynamics caused by this mutation.
title: Reformer: Deep learning model for characterizing protein-RNA interactions from sequence at single-base resolution

finding: Near the AL162389.1 gene, this SNP was involved in associations driven by binary traits related to coronary heart disease, with demonstrated high genetic correlations.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: This SNP in the AKNA gene was associated with HDL and total cholesterol, while also showing moderate links with myocardial infarction.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The common variant rs1333048 located in the 9p21 region was significantly associated with prevalent coronary heart disease (CHD) as well as with increased risk of incident myocardial infarction (MI), indicating its multifaceted impact on cardiovascular disease.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs4977574, also in the 9p21 region, showed significant associations with prevalent CHD and increased risk of incident MI, further establishing its relevance in cardiovascular health.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs10757278 was associated with incident myocardial infarction (MI), reinforcing the connection between 9p21 region variants and heart disease.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs1333049, identified within the 9p21 locus, was significantly linked to incident myocardial infarction (MI), contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for cardiovascular events.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: Similarly, this SNP was part of the same GWAS that detected rs11385942, being located at locus 9q34.2. Its association with severe COVID-19 was established through this study.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: The variant rs631287 (G/A) was identified as puQTL associated with the minor promoter prmtr.109751 of the MAPKAP1 gene (p = 1.64 x 10^-38, beta = -0.80) but was not linked to other promoters or the total expression of MAPKAP1 (p = 0.046). This indicates that the association may derive from a different regulatory mechanism than traditional eQTL observations.
title: Mapping of promoter usage QTL using RNA-seq data reveals their contributions to complex traits

finding: The SNP rs12380860 achieved a p-value of 8.62 × 10-9, appearing as another novel signal of selection discovered within the investigated loci.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs4986790, at the TLR4 locus, was noted for its significant association with malaria susceptibility, with a p-value of 7.60 × 10-12, qualifying it as a newly identified signal of selection.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The rs28592848 SNP exhibited a genome-wide significant eQTL signal associated with the PTGDS gene, which was upregulated in islets from T2D donors. It showed correlations with key islet hormones (INS, GCG, and IAPP) and was linked to HbA1c levels. This variant demonstrated suggestive association signals during IVGTT with acute insulin response and peak insulin response, emphasizing its potential significance in T2D pathogenesis.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: Similar to rs28592848, the rs28375538 SNP also showed a genome-wide significant eQTL signal for the PTGDS gene. It was significantly correlated with various indices of insulin secretion during IVGTT, signifying its relevance in insulin regulatory pathways and the broader scope of T2D risk mechanisms.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: The splice variant rs146597587-C in the IL33 gene was found to be significantly protective against asthma with a p-value of 8.0 x 10^-10 and an odds ratio of 0.58. This splice variant was particularly notable because it exhibited low carrier rates among early-onset asthma cases compared to late-onset cases and was functionally characterized as a loss-of-function variant. Carriers had significantly lower eosinophil counts than non-carriers, indicating a unique protective effect in asthma pathogenesis.
title: A broad exome study of the genetic architecture of asthma reveals novel patient subgroups

finding: The SNP rs7034653, located in the third intron of TRAF1, was identified through a series of genetic analyses as a causal variant associated with inflammatory arthritis risk. Specifically, the G risk allele of this SNP was shown to reduce binding of the transcription factor FRA2, leading to decreased TRAF1 expression and increased TNF production in stimulated monocytes. Conditional analyses revealed that this variant accounted for all genetic risk signals at TRAF1/C5 with respect to both juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA), indicating a shared mechanism in both conditions.
title: Identification of a regulatory pathway governing TRAF1 via an arthritis-associated non-coding variant

finding: SNP rs7039505 was confirmed as a causal variant within the TRAF1/C5 locus, achieving ImmunoChip significance (P=2.39 × 10^-7, odds ratio=1.15). The analysis indicated that rs7039505 is in close physical proximity to other variants associated with risk for juvenile idiopathic arthritis but is distinct in its ability to drive TRAF1 expression, suggesting its role in genetic predisposition to JIA.
title: Identification of a regulatory pathway governing TRAF1 via an arthritis-associated non-coding variant

finding: The SNP rs4621895 was found to have a modifying effect by maternal alcohol consumption on the genetic relative risk (GRR). The study reported that without adjusting for genetic structure, maternal alcohol consumption increased the GRR at SNP rs4621895 by a factor of approximately 2.1 for all trios. However, when accounting for East Asian and European populations, the effect varied significantly. For East Asian trios, the GRR decreased by a factor of about 0.73, while for European trios, it increased by a factor of about 2.4. This highlighted that any gene-environment interaction signal was primarily observed in trios of European ancestry.
title: Inference of gene-environment interaction from heterogeneous case-parent trios

finding: With respect to SNP rs2780841, the findings indicated that the confidence intervals for hypothetical East Asians covered one, suggesting no significant interaction, whereas the confidence interval did not cover one for hypothetical Europeans, indicating a significant gene-environment interaction linked to maternal alcohol consumption. This reinforced the preference for European ancestry in detecting gene-environment interaction signals.
title: Inference of gene-environment interaction from heterogeneous case-parent trios

finding: This SNP (Gly267Ala) was part of a series of assessments where it was used to infer A and B blood group antigens. Among individuals analyzed, there was one case where an individual expressed the A antigen despite being inferred as type B due to this variant's heterozygosity, showing the complexity of blood group genetics.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP (Leu265Met) contributed to inferring A and B antigens along with rs8176747. It was observed that discordance in blood type predictions occurred in conjunction with this and adjacent variants, revealing potential misclassifications when serological results were confirmed.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This SNP (Thr87AspfsTer107) played a key role in inferring the O blood group antigen. However, it was found in a haplotype typically expressing A antigen, contributing to misidentifications of phenotypes in some individuals in the study.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The rs581080 SNP was associated with serum lipid levels and risk of coronary artery disease (CAD). This SNP was located within the TTC39B gene, which was implicated in the genetic variance linked to HDL qualitative traits affecting CAD risk.
title: High-density lipoprotein characteristics and coronary heart disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs7020538 was identified in studies examining glioblastoma, specifically in relation to molecular pathways and therapeutic targets. Research indicated that variations at this locus could influence the response to therapies, especially those targeting epigenetic modifications. The detailed mechanism was explored using advanced phenotypic screening techniques that aligned treatment responses with genetic markers.
title: Improving drug discovery using image-based multiparametric analysis of the epigenetic landscape

finding: The SNP rs579459 was identified as a protective factor for preeclampsia, driven by its association with elevated alkaline phosphatase (ALP). This SNP is located upstream of the ABO gene, which encodes proteins for the ABO blood group system. C-allele carriers of rs579459 (blood group A) were shown to have increased levels of LDL cholesterol and an increased risk of adverse cardiac outcomes. Despite this, it contributed to the reduced odds of developing PE, overall OR 0.89.
title: Risk of preeclampsia in patients with genetic predisposition to common medical conditions: a case-control study

finding: The SNP rs7848647 was identified as a strongly associated variant within the TNFSF15 locus. It was connected to IBD and influenced chromatin accessibility and gene expression in both LCLs and monocytes.
title: Chromatin accessibility variation provides insights into missing regulation underlying immune-mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs1563 was recognized as a significant finding in the context of maize metabolism as reported by Saha et al. (2011). It was associated with the comprehensive genome-scale metabolic reconstruction of maize, which highlighted the importance of this SNP in determining metabolic pathways relevant to plant growth and development. This finding was particularly relevant for understanding genetic variations that influence metabolic processes within Zea mays.
title: iEC7871 Quercus suber model: the first multi-tissue diel cycle genome-scale metabolic model of a woody tree

finding: The SNP rs12341335, located near the TUSC1 gene, involved a significant GxS interaction (p=2.29×10−7), which was particularly noted for BIP.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: rs7029757 was found to colocalise with TOR1B expression but was not previously linked to any specific traits, indicating a novel association.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: Associated with pancreatic fat (p=1.6e-12, beta=0.077) linked to lipid and cardiovascular traits, reinforcing its relevance in metabolic health.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs10121905 was associated with urbanization impacts on vegetation phenology in China, which highlighted how urbanization influenced phenological changes. These findings were relevant in understanding how different types of urban environments affected the start of season in vegetation.
title: The phenological response of European vegetation to urbanisation is mediated by macrobioclimatic factors

finding: The rs1537373 SNP was identified at the 9p21 locus (ANRIL/CDKN2B-AS1), associated with CAD variants across smooth muscle, fibroblast, and pericyte cell types.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The rs505922 variant was identified as a trans pQTL for VWF, found 141Kb upstream of the ADAMTS13 gene. This demonstrated a reciprocal relationship in the ADAMTS13-vWF axis, reinforcing the importance of this pathway in thrombosis.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs357564 exhibited a high XPEHH score of 4.5412, confirming its association with pigmentation phenotypes. This variant is located in the PTCH1 gene on chromosome 9 and displayed differentiated selection patterns in the HM population.
title: Genomic insights into the population history and biological adaptation of Southwestern Chinese Hmong-Mien people

finding: The SNP rs17180299 was identified in the context of a genome-wide pharmacogenomic study on methadone maintenance treatment. It was associated with variations in plasma concentrations of methadone R- and S-enantiomers among heroin-dependent patients. This finding emphasized the role of genetic variation in influencing treatment outcomes for opioid dependency, thereby linking heritable factors to substance use traits in the brain's reward circuitry.
title: Single Nucleus Transcriptomics Reveals Pervasive Glial Activation in Opioid Overdose Cases

finding: The rs3847302 SNP was identified within an NR-specific enhancer region and is known to be associated with HDL cholesterol levels. It was highlighted that this SNP might disrupt transcription factor binding, particularly affecting HNF4A, which is one of the key transcription factors linked to the NR phenotype.
title: Super-enhancer signature reveals key mechanisms associated with resistance to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis in humans with obesity

finding: The SNP rs7030860 was found to be involved in targeting receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) signaling pathways, which are critical in various cancers, highlighting its importance in understanding cancer mechanisms.
title: Manipulating the EphB4-ephrinB2 axis to reduce metastasis in HNSCC

finding: The T2D GWAS variant rs10811660 was shown to decrease CRE accessibility in INS high beta cells. It was associated with increased expression of CDKN2A, which has implications for T2D risk due to its influence on beta cell function and proliferation.
title: Deconvolution of polygenic risk score in single cells unravels cellular and molecular heterogeneity of complex human diseases

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with alkaline phosphatase in European populations, suggesting its role in metabolic phenotypes (beta=0.096, p=3.69×10^-116).
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP had a significant association with coronary artery disease, highlighting its role in cardiovascular genetics.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The SNP rs10811661, situated upstream of the CDKN2A/2B gene, was found to have a significant association with GDM in women. This association emphasized the role of genetic factors in GDM susceptibility.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: This SNP correlated with Parkinson’s disease highlighting its proposed regulatory impact in neurodegenerative processes.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs7856850, located in an intron of PTPRD, was significantly associated with obsessive-compulsive (OC) traits at a genome-wide significance level (p=2.48×10−8). This locus also showed association with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) in a meta-analysis involving three independent case-control datasets (p=0.0069), indicating a shared genetic risk between OC traits and clinical OCD.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pediatric Obsessive-Compulsive Traits: Shared Genetic Risk between Traits and Disorder

finding: The SNP rs10120514 was associated with the racial disparity in outcomes for triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) in African American women. The study analyzed race-specific factors such as obesity, biological mechanisms, and socioeconomic determinants that contributed to these outcomes. The finding revealed a significant correlation between this SNP and unique tumor-promoting and immunosuppressive microenvironments in African American patients, which aligned with the overall context of poor survival associated with certain TNBC tumor characteristics.
title: Integrative spatial omics reveals distinct tumor-promoting multicellular niches and immunosuppressive mechanisms in African American and European American patients with TNBC

finding: The SNP rs1572905, which is a G>A substitution, was identified in the context of analyzing prime editing modifications in the FANCF gene. It was noted that the comparison of reported prime editing percentages between CRISPR-A and CRISPResso2 showed discrepancies due to this SNP being in heterozygosity. CRISPResso2 reported a high number of PE with modifications or reference with modifications attributed to this SNP, whereas CRISPR-A provided higher editing percentages of template-based editions. This indicated that the presence of this variant impacted the accuracy of modification classification in gene editing assessments.
title: CRISPR-Analytics (CRISPR-A): a platform for precise analytics and simulations for gene editing

finding: Carriers of the LOF variant <italic>IL33</italic>, driven by rs146597587, were associated with increased eosinophils, indicating a potential role in immune response and inflammation.
title: Whole exome sequencing and characterization of coding variation in 49,960 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10114470 was identified as a high-confidence fine-mapped variant associated with Crohn's disease (CD), located in the 3' UTR of the TL1A gene. This variant was linked to elevated activity in ILC3s, suggesting a significant role in the pathogenesis of ILC3-mediated inflammatory processes in CD.
title: High-resolution promoter interaction analysis in Type 3 Innate Lymphoid Cells implicates Batten Disease gene CLN3 in Crohn’s Disease aetiology

finding: The AKNA_rs531892793 variant, an intronic variant associated with lower levels of several glucosylceramide species, was identified as a potentially functional variant in the AKNA gene region. It indicated significant regulatory potential and has shown enrichment in the Amish population.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: The rs4743930 T allele was associated with increased BMI and diabetes risk, particularly among individuals with low physical activity. The interactions were statistically significant with a p-values of 8.5 × 10^-11 for BMI and 2.7 × 10^-5 for diabetes risk, supporting the notion of GxE effects influencing these phenotypes.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: This SNP, which determines the O blood group, was associated with a protective effect against severe malaria in African populations, though an opposite effect was observed in Papua New Guinea.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: The SNP rs28368130, located at chromosome 9p21, was definitively associated with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG). It influenced CDKN2B expression specifically in the RGC1 cell population, with a disease-status FDR p-value of 4.67×10^-4. This finding was significant in understanding the genetic basis of POAG.
title: Retinal ganglion cell-specific genetic regulation in primary open angle glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs7030789 was associated with EHR-OSA in the Geisinger dataset, beta = 0.05 (p = 3.57 x 10^-2), indicative of its role in OSA pathology.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The study identified rs2997560 as associated with a predicted change in f-VICE in pancreatic islets. This finding indicated that variations at this SNP influenced chromatin information enrichment, which reflects functional biological variation in gene expression and chromatin accessibility.
title: Chromatin information content landscapes inform transcription factor and DNA interactions

finding: The SNP rs364477 in the DMRT1 gene showed a pronounced presence of the ancestral allele among populations from North West India and South West coast when compared to the Gangetic plain groups. This suggests that these populations share a closer genetic relationship, potentially reflecting historical migration patterns.
title: Genetic affinities and adaptation of the South West coast populations of India

finding: The minor C allele of SNP rs7873784 was found to be associated with rheumatoid arthritis and type-2 diabetes mellitus. It was demonstrated that this allele binds to the PU.1 transcription factor, which in turn enhances the expression of TLR4, a gene significant in inflammatory responses. This finding highlighted the role of genetic variations in contributing to the susceptibility of these diseases.
title: Adversary of DNA integrity: a long non-coding RNA stimulates driver oncogenic chromosomal rearrangement in human thyroid cells

finding: The SNP rs72748148 on 9q31.3 was associated with connectivity in the left putamen, showing a positive z-score of 7.35.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This SNP was associated with body mass index and showed a significant protein-protein interaction with TNC and FAM163A, which indicates a role in the regulation of BMI.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: This SNP was annotated as a 3 prime UTR variant in the ABO locus, identified as a highly pleiotropic locus that associates with over 20 trans-associations, including significant links to blood cell traits.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: Annotated as a 3 prime UTR variant in the ABO locus as well, this SNP is part of the same context of high pleiotropy associated with various blood cell traits.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: This SNP was validated in a meta-analysis as an intron variant in the ABO locus, demonstrating its association with red blood cell traits and previously studied variants in this region.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: In the context of sample PD4781, the SNP rs12343867 was found to be heterozygous for the 46/1 haplotype. However, it was further observed that a sample from the JAK2-mutant dominant clade became wildtype for the 46/1 haplotype due to 9pUPD. In contrast, a sample from the JAK2-mutant minor clade became homozygous for 46/1, indicating distinct clonal evolution in relation to the JAK2 mutation status.
title: Phylogenetic reconstruction of myeloproliferative neoplasm reveals very early origins and lifelong evolution

finding: The SNP rs774358 was associated with the expression of the C9orf72 gene and the DNA methylation of a nearby CpG site (cg01126010), demonstrating a molQTL effect that increased with higher monocyte and neutrophil abundance. Notably, the C9orf72 repeat expansion is known as a genetic hallmark of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), indicating that this iQTL captures a myeloid cell-specific effect related to disease.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: The SNP rs755109, located at chr9:100,696,202, was associated with a cell-type-specific enhancer (chr9:100,695,253-100,696,742) and its nearby gene HEMGN, which is specifically expressed in K562 cells and mobilized adult CD34+ primary cells. The study demonstrated that deletion of the surrounding enhancer using CRISPR/Cas9 reduced Hemgn expression in mouse MEL cells, indicating its functional role in enhancer-driven regulation at the adult developmental stage.
title: Enhancer-dependence of gene expression increases with developmental age

finding: The SNP rs10120468 was implicated in the differential expression of genes associated with four HGSC molecular sub-types. Its relevance was highlighted in the context of increased inflammatory signaling observed in distal differentiated TE cells, promoting the notion of heightened susceptibility to malignant transformation in these regions.
title: WNT and inflammatory signaling distinguish human Fallopian tube epithelial cell populations

finding: The lead variant rs10117940 was highlighted in colocalization analyses and had an effect size of 1.299. It was identified as being in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with two STARR-seq regulatory variants and a PCOS-associated rare variant, indicating its contribution to altering gene expression related to the DENND1A locus.
title: Gene regulatory activity associated with PCOS revealed DENND1A-dependent testosterone production

finding: The minor C allele of the SNP rs7873784 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and type-2 diabetes mellitus. It was found to bind PU.1 and enhance expression of TLR4, indicating a role in the pathogenesis of these autoimmune diseases.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs7044343 was positively associated with a decreased risk of developing premature coronary artery disease and central obesity. This variant could also influence IL-33 production, which relates to the immune response to infections, including pneumococcal pneumonia.
title: IL-33 controls IL-22-dependent antibacterial defense by modulating the microbiota

finding: The SNP rs56405676 within the NTRK2 gene was significantly associated with increased hippocampal volumes in individuals older than 60, specifically for those homozygous for the major allele (T). This highlighted a direct association between this SNP and hippocampal volume.
title: Investigating neurotrophin genetics and hippocampal volume

finding: The SNP rs55682638 from the SLC24A2 gene demonstrated significant associations with pain sensitivity, exhibiting main effects on GMD in the pallidum and putamen. The analysis showed that individuals with CC genotypes demonstrated higher GMD in both high and low pain sensitivity groups. Further, the SNP had significant interaction effects with pain sensitivity (p-values of 0.0021 and 0.0013), indicating that this genetic variant played a crucial role in GMD differences affecting pain modulation.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic profiles influence on brain morphology and their interactions with pain sensitivity individual differences

finding: This variant was identified as the lead variant from multivariate analysis related to the VLDLR locus, outperforming the univariate lead variant (rs10967570) and suggesting a causal relationship.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The lead variant from multivariate analysis in the ABO locus (p = 8.5×10<sup>-14</sup>), identified associations with various endpoints including anemia.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This SNP was recognized as a trans-deQTL associated with GNLY expression, wherein its effects on variance were established under significant thresholds in NK cells.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The SNP rs2381416, which was upstream of GTF3AP1, was found to associate with asthma, showing an effect size of -0.11. This variant had previously been identified in studies linking it to eosinophil count and severity of childhood asthma, indicating its relevance in the context of asthma as a common disease with potential monogenic signatures.
title: Fast Lasso method for Large-scale and Ultrahigh-dimensional Cox Model with applications to UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs55695858 weakened an alternative 3' splice site, which led to the upregulation of exon extension. Borzoi successfully predicted this functional change based on RNA-seq coverage observations.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs11145917 was found to be located near the INPP5E gene and demonstrated associations with two genes involved in the alpha interferon response. Although only two genes reached genome-wide significance, others slightly fell short, indicating that this locus may influence upstream signaling components of the alpha interferon response. The INPP5E locus is implicated in various autoimmune diseases and immune-cell composition phenotypes, and this study suggested that it may modulate baseline activity of the alpha interferon pathway, highlighting its potential clinical significance.
title: DataRemix: a universal data transformation for optimal inference from gene expression datasets

finding: The SNP rs10738466, located on chromosome 9, was the top SNP by eQTL probability for the gene R11-455G15.1, which participated in associations with ovarian cancer risk.
title: Cis- and trans-eQTL TWAS of breast and ovarian cancer identify more than 100 risk associated genes in the BCAC and OCAC consortia

finding: The study identified rs8176719 as a significant variant associated with the <italic>ABO</italic> gene. This frameshift indel caused by the deletion of a C nucleotide in exon 6 led to an early termination and was found to be a genetic determinant of the histo-blood group antigens. Individuals homozygous for this deletion exhibited blood group O, which has been previously associated with a protective effect against Crohn's Disease (CD). The analysis revealed a trend towards higher <italic>ABO</italic> expression in CD tissue compared to non-IBD controls, suggesting its potential role in IBD susceptibility.
title: eQTL in diseased colon tissue identifies novel target genes associated with IBD

finding: The SNP rs199476103, linked to Cartilage Hair Hypoplasia (CHH) and resulting in the c.A71G mutation, was included in the SNV editing protocol. The results showed successful correction of this mutation in patient T cells, supporting the use of HDR-based approaches for correcting various monogenic mutations effectively.
title: T cell correction pipeline for Inborn Errors of Immunity

finding: This novel missense variant in SVEP1 was one of the 20 SNPs with deleterious effects, showing significance in functional studies related to lymphangiogenesis, thereby underscoring its importance in POAG.
title: A large cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies 69 novel risk loci for primary open-angle glaucoma and includes a genetic link with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This synonymous variant in ABO was identified as a novel POAG-associated SNP. It was part of the 20 SNPs with predicted pathogenic effects.
title: A large cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies 69 novel risk loci for primary open-angle glaucoma and includes a genetic link with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Rs576123 was linked to multiple metabolic pathways and showed effects across six tissues involving the ABO gene, with implications on insulin secretion related to T2D.
title: Understanding functional consequences of type 2 diabetes risk loci using the universal data integration and visualization R package CONQUER

finding: SNP rs10821352 was found to have a significant trans-eQTL effect on CYP2C8 in the Remixed ROSMAP dataset, marking it as the first replicated trans-eQTL effect reported in human brain data. This effect was replicated in another dataset, the Common Mind Consortium, with a very low p-value of 3.1382e-16, validating its significance. CYP2C8's involvement in metabolism of polyunsaturated fatty acids has links to xenobiotic metabolism, reflected in its correlation network with other genes. However, there were no detected cis-eQTLs for rs10821352 in ROSMAP and none reported in GTEx brain data, leaving the mechanistic nature of the genotype affecting CYP2C8 expression unclear.
title: DataRemix: a universal data transformation for optimal inference from gene expression datasets

finding: The T allele of the nonsense polymorphism (rs2039381, Gln71Stop) in the interferon-epsilon (IFNε) gene was identified as a risk factor for the development of intracerebral hemorrhage. This finding suggested a detrimental effect of this specific SNP on the immune response, potentially impacting the host's vulnerability to various infections including those affecting the female reproductive tract.
title: Constitutive expression and distinct properties of IFN-epsilon protect the female reproductive tract from Zika virus infection

finding: The SNP rs72743916, situated on chromosome 9, was identified as the most statistically significant within its locus. It is located in an intron of the gene ERCC6L2, which is linked to developmental delays and learning difficulties when mutated. This association with a gene affecting neurodevelopment suggests a potential mechanism for its influence on happiness.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Analysis of Happiness: Consistent Genetic Effects Across the Lifespan and Across Genetic Ancestries in Multiple Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs1888909 was found to be associated with increased expression of the IL33 gene and IL-33 protein levels in human airway epithelial cells and plasma. This effect was linked to differential binding of the transcription factor OCT-1 (POU2F1) to the risk allele of this SNP, suggesting a regulatory role in the genetic risk of asthma.
title: Asthma-associated variants induce IL33 differential expression through a novel regulatory region

finding: The SNP rs10975479 was associated with IL33 expression, similar to rs1888909, and played a role in enhancer blocking activity in functional assays, suggesting its significance in regulating IL33.
title: Asthma-associated variants induce IL33 differential expression through a novel regulatory region

finding: The SNP rs28505901 exhibited significantly stronger chromatin interactions specifically with the DNLZ promoter in EndoC-βH1 cells, and was implicated as a genetic signal at the GPSM1 locus.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: This variant was associated with significant effects on gene expression through CRISPR experiments, showing activity in at least one cell type, particularly affecting the C9orf84 gene.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The synonymous variant rs150813342 displayed ATU effects that resulted in changes in transcript usage impacting GFI1B, which is a key regulator of hematopoiesis.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs10758656 was characterized as causing significant reductions in chromatin accessibility and corresponding decreases in JAK2 gene expression, indicating its role as an effector gene in erythropoiesis.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs104894097 in the CDKN2A gene was identified as significant for its ability to help differentiate PCAND from T2DM, also with a p-value of 0.001, underlining its potential importance in understanding pancreatic cancer mechanisms.
title: Sorcin-STAT3-Serpin E1/CCL5 axis can be the trigger of pancreatic cancer-associated new-onset diabetes

finding: This SNP, rs7040170, was found to mediate the effect of dopamine beta-hydroxylase (DBH) on novelty seeking, a trait that could be related to the temperamental characteristics observed in eating disorders, including anorexia nervosa (AN). The findings provided context on how variations in cortical surface area of the insula could influence behavioral traits that are significant in the vulnerability to such psychopathologies.
title: Neuroanatomical correlates of temperament and cognitive function in women with and without anorexia nervosa

finding: The SNP rs62556120 was causally associated with increased risk of ulcerative colitis and inflammatory bowel disease. This SNP also had significant impacts on protein levels, showing its critical role in disease etiology.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs2230805 was identified as a common gene variant associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding highlighted the role of the ABCA1 gene in the pathology of AD, particularly in the context of lipid dysregulation and reactive oxygen species (ROS) which are implicated in neuronal toxicity.
title: Neuronal ROS-Induced Glial Lipid Droplet Formation is Altered by Loss of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated Genes

finding: The SNP rs2230806 was also identified as a common gene variant associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). Similar to rs2230805, this SNP's association further supported the involvement of the ABCA1 gene in the mechanisms related to AD, emphasizing its role in glial lipid droplet formation and neuronal protection against ROS-induced damage.
title: Neuronal ROS-Induced Glial Lipid Droplet Formation is Altered by Loss of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated Genes

finding: In the analysis, rs7870658 was found within the intron of REPS1 and was associated with cardiometabolic diseases related to type 2 diabetes, such as coronary artery disease and chronic kidney disease. This significant association highlighted its potential clinical relevance in metabolic diseases.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: Reported associations with ER-positive risks and thus expanded the understanding of genetic predispositions.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Indicated associations sourced specifically within ER-positive and PR-positive tumor groups.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: In the context of thyroid gene regulation, rs4297160 was identified as a significant trans-eVariant associated with both MAPRE3 (p-value <= 6.6 × 10^-11) and ARFGEF3 (p-value <= 2.2 × 10^-16). Located within the lincRNA gene PTCSC2, this SNP was linked to a predisposition for papillary thyroid cancer. The 9q22 locus, home to the thyroid-specific transcription factor FOXE1, was previously associated with ARFGEF3 in trans, and rs4297160 was shown to affect expression across 34 different genes in the thyroid without controlling for PEER factors, including genes implicated in thyroid function such as HECW1, COL-GALT2, and FMO5.
title: Telescoping bimodal latent Dirichlet allocation to identify expression QTLs across tissues

finding: The variant rs7030256, located in the PTCSC2 gene, was associated with significant histological changes in thyroid tissue, including increased colloid and enlarged follicles. This alteration was linked to potential goiter development and was part of a signal previously associated with hypothyroidism. The analysis revealed associations with the expression levels of 128 genes, including regulators of thyroid hormone secretion and genes linked to thyroid cancer.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI-enabled Framework for Automated Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes in Histology Cohorts

finding: The study identified a significant association between circ/linANRIL abundance and genotype at rs564398, which is located within ANRIL exon 2. Specifically, the T2D risk (T) allele at rs564398 was associated with higher circ/linANRIL abundance, suggesting its role in the regulation of glucose metabolism and beta cell proliferation in Type II Diabetes (T2D) phenotypes.
title: High-throughput analysis of ANRIL circRNA isoforms in human pancreatic islets

finding: The rs2378757 variant was identified as a very significant eQTL that conferred highly variable expression of the CTSL gene, particularly in lung tissues. It was associated with lower baseline expression of CTSL, which likely correlated to a better response to SARS-CoV-2 infection, while higher expression was potentially linked to increased viral load.
title: “Amantadine disrupts lysosomal gene expression; potential therapy for COVID19”

finding: The rs114063116 variant was found to be a relevant splice QTL affecting splicing ratios of the CTSL transcripts in lung tissues. This suggests that this variant could play a significant role in tissue-specific regulatory programs for CTSL, potentially influencing susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: “Amantadine disrupts lysosomal gene expression; potential therapy for COVID19”

finding: The SNP rs1326779 on the TYRP1 locus was identified as a significant variant associated with eye colour, indicating its role in pigmentary traits.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: This SNP was included among previously studied variants associated with eye colour, indicating its relevance in polymorphic traits.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: The SNP rs13297008 had noteworthy potential as a candidate causal SNP within the TYRP1 locus.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: The rs1927911 SNP in the TLR4 gene was associated with the rate of motor decline in Huntington's disease (HD) patients. This SNP suggested a role in neuroinflammation and potentially altered cognitive decline related to HD.
title: Deletion of the microglial transmembrane immune signaling adaptor TYROBP ameliorates Huntington’s disease mouse phenotype

finding: The rs10116253 SNP, also in the TLR4 gene, was similarly linked to the rate of motor decline in HD patients. This finding emphasized the involvement of the TLR4 pathway in the disease's progression.
title: Deletion of the microglial transmembrane immune signaling adaptor TYROBP ameliorates Huntington’s disease mouse phenotype

finding: The SNP rs532436 was found to be genome-wide significantly associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels (P=9.98×10^{-112}), total cholesterol (TC) levels (P=1.68×10^{-98}), and breast cancer risk (P=2.9×10^{-8}). It lay within an intron of the ABO gene, which was suggested to be a possible causal gene for the observed associations.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk: Mendelian randomization study

finding: Similar to rs532436, the SNP rs635634 was identified in high linkage disequilibrium with rs532436 (r^2=0.99) and was also genome-wide significantly associated with LDL levels (P=9.98×10^{-112}), TC (P=1.68×10^{-98}), and breast cancer (P=2.9×10^{-8}). It was located within the intron of the ABO gene, indicating potential implications for gene expression related to lipid levels and breast cancer risk.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk: Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs10993329 was identified as more likely to be functional in the ZNF169 locus due to its overlap with snATAC-seq peaks and its predicted allelic effects, including the loss of transcription factor binding motifs that are crucial for pancreatic mesodermal development.
title: Regulatory variants active in iPSC-derived pancreatic progenitor cells are associated with Type 2 Diabetes in adults

finding: Variant rs10757282 at the CDK2NA/B locus was also a T2D risk variant, overlapping with phenotype-associated beta cell cREs that exhibited lower accessibility at higher BMI values (PIP=0.99). This provided further evidence of genetic influences on glucose metabolism.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: SNP rs143563851 was identified with a CADD deleteriousness score of 24.2. It had been recently reported in a cohort of 211 Palestinians, indicating its relevance in blood group antigen synthase GBGT1.
title: An integrated personal and population-based Egyptian genome reference

finding: The CARD9 G111E mutation (rs371695061) was identified as a potentially activating germ-line mutation. This variant was noted to correlate with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), fibromyalgia, and other conditions, linking it to autoimmune and inflammatory phenotypes.
title: “Franken-CARD9”: chimeric proteins for high-resolution studies of activating mutations in CARD10, CARD11 and CARD14

finding: The SNP rs1049430, located in the 3'-UTR of the SH3GL2 gene, was found to regulate gene expression. This regulation had clinical and prognostic implications in patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, highlighting its significance in cancer biology. The original finding established a clear connection between this SNP and altered expression levels of SH3GL2.
title: Estimating allele-specific expression of SNVs from 10x Genomics Single-Cell RNA-Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs1563 was part of the documented maize genome-scale metabolic model called iRS1563. This model contributed to the understanding of maize metabolism and was a significant original finding as it represented the first comprehensive reconstruction of metabolic pathways specific to maize. The context of this finding relates to its role in enhancing the understanding of organ-specific interactions in maize, which was essential for developing strategies for improving maize productivity under temperature stress conditions.
title: Multi-organ Metabolic Model of Zea mays Connects Temperature Stress with Thermodynamics-Reducing Power-Energy Generation Axis

finding: The SNP rs8176719 was directly linked to the O allele in the context of the ABO gene. It resulted in higher odds ratios for severe malaria among those with the genotype OO compared to the AO genotype, supporting the hypothesis that individuals with double dose non-O genotypes are more susceptible to severe malaria.
title: Non-O ABO blood group genotypes differ in their associations with Plasmodium falciparum rosetting and severe malaria

finding: The SNP rs8176746 distinguished between A and B alleles in individuals. In the study, its presence in genotypes AA and AB was associated with increased formation of larger P. falciparum rosettes, indicating a greater risk of malaria pathology compared to OO or AO genotypes.
title: Non-O ABO blood group genotypes differ in their associations with Plasmodium falciparum rosetting and severe malaria

finding: The SNP rs500102 was located near the promoter region of the RORB gene. In the context of single-nucleus Methyl-3C Sequencing (sn-m3C-seq) data, findings revealed enhanced chromatin interaction strength in the adult PFC L4-5 FOXP2 cell population around the RORB region, coupled with a decrease in CG methylation signal compared to other cell populations. This observation was particularly notable in excitatory neurons within the PFC L4-5 FOXP2 cell cluster, indicating significant epigenetic variation associated with RORB during brain development.
title: Empowering Integrative and Collaborative Exploration of Single-Cell and Spatial Multimodal Data with SGS

finding: The SNP rs4878832, located in the ANKRD18A gene, also showed an association with Module 3. Similar to rs6465878, this finding was identified at the relaxed significance threshold of 5×10^-7, suggesting that this SNP may contribute to the immune profile related to the development of respiratory diseases.
title: Network Analysis Reveals Protein Modules Associated with Childhood Respiratory Diseases

finding: The SNP rs544873 was associated with multiple conditions including pulmonary heart disease, phlebitis and thrombophlebitis, hemorrhoids, circulatory disease, and diverticulosis as identified in the UK Biobank data, indicating its potential role in pleiotropy.
title: NETMAGE: a humaN-disEase phenoType MAp GEnerator for the Visualization of PheWAS

finding: The SNP rs925488 showed associations with thyroid cancer, nontoxic nodular and multinodular goiter, and hypothyroidism, as recognized in the UK Biobank data, further emphasizing its implications in pleiotropy.
title: NETMAGE: a humaN-disEase phenoType MAp GEnerator for the Visualization of PheWAS

finding: The frameshift insertion variant rs8176719 at the ABO locus associated with E-selectin levels was significant in the analysis, illustrating the genetic influence of blood group on E-selectin levels. It was previously identified but not as an independent signal.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The variant rs374594061 associated with E-selectin was rare across all populations and represented a distinct signal in the analysis, although no prior associations were reported for it in the GWAS catalog.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: At the ABO locus, the signal rs635634 remained significant in the analysis, reinforcing its connections to diverse biological traits.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The variant rs35093463 was located in the intron of the ABCA1 gene, which is critical for high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDLC) homeostasis. Its discovery was facilitated by the higher allele frequency in the Japanese population (MAF 36%) compared to Europeans (MAF 5%), contributing to the identified susceptibility locus for coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP near DBH was noted for its association with smoking trajectory II, contributing to understanding smoking cessation contexts.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs3025360 variant near DBH was indicated as a novel GWS locus for smoking cessation in the present study, thereby confirming its relevance.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: Identified as one of the novel GWS loci associated with smoking cessation, located on SCAI, this finding adds to the understanding of smoking behavior genetics.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: Identified for smoking cessation, this SNP on PPP6C demonstrated significant colocalization, indicating its role in smoking behaviors.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The study identified rs6475604 as a functional glaucoma risk variant located in an enhancer region of the 9p21.3 locus. The risk allele (C) of rs6475604 disrupted the binding of YY1, a transcription factor that represses the expression of the neighboring gene p16INK4A, linking the variant to cellular senescence, which is a critical mechanism in aging and glaucoma pathogenesis.
title: Identification and functional validation of an enhancer variant in the 9p21.3 locus associated with glaucoma risk and elevated expression of p16INK4a

finding: The SNP rs17230081 was identified as a potential regulatory site influencing the development of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM). This finding was highlighted through a combined analysis of Orm2 potential SNP sites in relation to obesity-related datasets, suggesting its relevance in the pathogenesis associated with obesity and related metabolic disorders.
title: Treatment of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis with recombinant Orosomucoid 2, an acute phase protein that attenuates the Erk1/2-PPARγ-Cd36 signaling pathway

finding: The SNP rs1340513, located in the JMJD2C gene, was found to be significantly associated with autism spectrum disorders (ASDs) in a Finnish sample. This finding highlighted a potential genetic link to the neuropsychiatric condition, emphasizing the relevance of genetic factors in understanding ASDs.
title: Systematic analysis of brain lactate and pH levels in 65 animal models related to neuropsychiatric conditions

finding: The SNP rs10120473 was significantly associated with the immune response in the context of smoking and cancer outcomes. This SNP was highlighted in the study by Vulpis et al. (2018), which discussed the role of specific natural killer cell subsets in cancer immunology. The finding suggested that genetic variations linked to immune cell subtypes could influence the effectiveness of immune responses in cancer patients, particularly among smokers and their susceptibility to multiple myeloma.
title: Large scale analysis of smoking-induced changes in the tumor immune microenvironment

finding: The rare-coding variant rs118203742, which results in a glycine to serine change at position 1035 (G1035S), was significantly associated with progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) (p-value = 0.031, Odds Ratio = 4.241), indicating a role for this TSC1 variant in the risk for tauopathies.
title: TSC1 loss-of-function increases risk for tauopathy by inducing tau acetylation and preventing autophagy-mediated tau clearance

finding: The SNP rs76386683 was part of a cluster that showed association with longitudinal cocaine use, with P-values ranging from 1.85 × 10^-7 to 1.93 × 10^-7, indicating a potential role in the genetic architecture underlying cocaine use.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: rs114386843 was included in the same cluster as rs76386683, further supporting its association with longitudinal cocaine use, reflected in the similar P-values.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: As part of the associated SNP cluster at 9q33, rs186274502 showed significance in relation to longitudinal cocaine use.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: The SNP rs376616438 was also significant within the cluster linked to longitudinal cocaine use, reinforcing the association with addiction traits.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: The SNP rs187855416 contributed to the identified cluster at 9q33 associated with longitudinal cocaine use, again emphasizing its relevance in addiction genetics.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: The rs2278973 SNP in the CACNA1B gene was identified as non-synonymous specifically in the short exon47 variant of CaV2.2. This SNP led to three possible amino acids at the corresponding position—Arginine (Arg), Leucine (Leu), or Histidine (His), while it was synonymous in the long exon47 variant and did not alter the amino acid. The predominant amino acid found was Arg, with a frequency of 91.7% in the population, signifying its likely ancestral form. This finding linked the SNP to risks for schizophrenia and Parkinson's disease and emphasized the importance of including alternative splicing analysis rather than examining SNPs in isolation.
title: The interplay between splicing of exons 18a and 47 differentially affects membrane targeting and function of human CaV2.2

finding: The SNP rs3011158 was associated with enhanced binding of unliganded ESR1 to chromatin, which was linked to a higher basal expression of E2-dependent genes in HSF1-deficient cells. This phenomenon correlated with weakened E2-stimulated regulation of transcription, indicating a potential role in breast cancer progression.
title: Heat Shock Factor 1 (HSF1) as a new tethering factor for ESR1 supporting its action in breast cancer

finding: Analysis of SNP rs7040885 suggested its relevance in the complexity of breast cancer as revealed by next generation sequencing data, indicating a contributing factor in breast cancer genomic landscapes.
title: Heat Shock Factor 1 (HSF1) as a new tethering factor for ESR1 supporting its action in breast cancer

finding: The rs7026071 locus at the C9orf3 gene was linked to atrial fibrillation risk and was similarly associated with ALS with a p-value of 0.049.
title: The interplay between host genetics and the gut microbiome reveals common and distinct microbiome features for human complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs3764435 was associated with Parkinson's disease (PD), as demonstrated in a case-control study involving Mexican Mestizos. This study revealed protective effects against the development of PD and cognitive impairment, indicating a potential genetic factor that could mitigate the risk or severity of these conditions.
title: DOPAL initiates αSynuclein-mediated impaired proteostasis in neuronal projections leading to enhanced vulnerability in Parkinson’s disease

finding: In a cohort of 86 mild COVID-19 patients, the GG homozygous genotype of TLR4 -2604G>A (rs10759931) was significantly associated with a higher risk of cognitive impairment post-SARS-CoV-2 infection, indicated by a p-value of 0.0234 and an odds ratio of 1.91. Conversely, the GA genotype was linked to a decreased risk, with a p-value of 0.0209 and an odds ratio of 0.50. This finding suggested a genetic predisposition impacting cognitive outcomes following COVID-19.
title: SARS-CoV-2 spike protein induces TLR-4-mediated long-term cognitive dysfunction recapitulating post-COVID syndrome

finding: The SNP rs7853758 associated with the gene SLC28A3 showed a negative correlation between its expression levels and cardiotoxicity following DOX and DNR treatments. This indicates that SLC28A3 may play a role in mediating cardiotoxicity effects related to these drugs.
title: Anthracycline-induced cardiotoxicity associates with a shared gene expression response signature to TOP2-inhibiting breast cancer drugs in cardiomyocytes

finding: The variant rs7867966 in the TRIM14 promoter was associated with alterations in the aCM score, affecting the expression of both TRIM14 and the nearby CORO2A gene. It served as a blood-specific eQTL, possibly disrupting a C/EBP binding site.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The SNP rs4837016 was located near the gene GAPVD1 on chromosome 9 and had a significant association with obstructive sleep apnoea (OSA), with a P-value of 1.5 x 10^-8. This finding contributed to the understanding of the genetic basis of OSA.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The rs2891168 SNP in the CDKN2B-AS gene was associated with coronary artery disease in the Iranian population, which supports its impact on heart health.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs4977574 SNP in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus was associated with hypertension in a study involving a risk cohort, demonstrating its implications for hypertension predisposition.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The CDKN2B-AS1 rs1333049 polymorphism was associated with myocardial infarction in subjects with type 2 diabetes, further highlighting its cardiovascular relevance.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs753085, residing in an intron of COL27A1, was found to have a significant association with varicose veins (VVs), with a P-value of 2.17×10^-11.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs78216177, located in an intron of DOCK8, was significantly associated with varicose veins (VVs) with a P-value of 5.80×10^-14.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs1985859 in the CORO2A gene was identified as a GWAS candidate gene predictive of radiosensitivity to preoperative chemoradiotherapy in rectal cancer patients. Studies indicated that patients with elevated CORO2A expression associated with this SNP had poorer overall survival, suggesting a significant impact on cancer prognosis. Additionally, downregulation of CORO2A correlated with reduced early apoptosis in colorectal cancer cells, emphasizing its role in cancer biology.
title: Coro2a, An Expression Quantitative Trait Gene Underlying Estq1, Controls Uterine Responsiveness to Estradiol

finding: The rs391957 variant was found to cis-regulate the expression of the oncogene GRP78, contributing to the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma. This suggested a significant association between this SNP and liver cancer development.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: The rs10739971 SNP demonstrated interaction effects with PGC and ERCC6 gene polymorphisms in the context of gastric cancer and atrophic gastritis, suggesting a complex genetic interplay that influences disease risk.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index
